loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married and has four children. He has received schooling through junior high school. 

David owns and operates a mechanics shop in Abura and has done this work for some time now. His wife is a hairdresser in their community. David uses his income to support his wife and children and save for their future. 

David will use the loan to purchase more spare parts and other supplies necessary to run his mechanics shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, David plans to develop his shop further.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts and other supplies necessary to run his mechanics shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ice cream cones, flavor, and other ingredients for making ice cream.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus has run a retail store for two years. She is 25 years of age and married with two children. Venus aspires to have a stable source of income so she can give her children a quality education, support a comfortable lifestyle for them, and sustain their basic necessities. The couple both work hard to earn a living.

Venus would like to request a loan of 7,000 PHP, which allows her to buy stock for her retail store. She hopes for continuous access to financial assistance in order to fulfill her goal in life. Venus hopes for approval of her requested loan amount so she can continue to improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy stock for her retail store.

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora es comerciante desde hace 30 años vende comida de lunes a domingo en uno de los mercados de chinandega, trabaja desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, es soltera madre y padre para su hija quien cursa el ultimo año de secundaria y por quien se esfuerza para que el día de mañana sea una profesional.
la señora empezó su negocio con capital propio, ahorrando poco a poco ya que ella trabajaba en el negocio de la mamá y posteriormente ella se independizo.

los financiamientos  los ha invertido en su negocio ha comprado granos básicos y su negocio en si lo ha mejorado bastante, su mobiliario lo ha cambiado y ha realizado varias mejoras en su negocio, la señora se siente muy agradecida con los financiamientos, podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que con las ganancias que tiene ella busca como arreglar su hogar también.
texts.en:
Carla del Socorro has been a merchant for thirty years. She sells food every day of the week in one of the markets in Chinandega. She works from 6 am to 4 pm. She is single, and acts as both father and mother to her daughter who is in her final year of secondary school. Carla works hard so that her daughter can be a professional one day soon.
She started her business with her own capital, saving up bit by bit from her work at her mother's business. She then became independent.
She has invested her loans in her business and has purchased basic grains. Her business has improved greatly. She has changed her furniture and made various improvements to her business. She is very grateful for these loans because her quality of life has improved and so she is using her income to improve her home as well.

loans.use: to buy basic grains by the quintal, as well as pop, salsa, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marlon Lenin

texts.es:
El Señor Marlon  de 37 años, es originario de la ciudad Somotillo, se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, honesta de buenas costumbres, social, responsable, dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia,  formada por 4 hijos y su esposa.

 Cuenta con un taller de metalúrgica y refrigeración, con 16 años de servicio ala población. Actualmente decidió reemplazar sus maquinas viejas por unas nuevas  tiene varios años de utilizarlas, de tal manera que se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de estas; Tronzadora (maquina para cortar metal), Pulidora, Taladro roca martillo de media, esto para mejorar su trabajo y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marlon is 37 years old. He is from the city of Somotillo. He is described as a hardworking, honest person with good habits. He is social, responsible and dedicated to his work and his family, made up of four children and his wife. 

His has a metalworking and refrigeration workshop, and has been serving the public for 16 years. Now he has decided to replace his old machines with new ones. He has been using them for several years. That is why he went to the Ceprodel offices to ask for a loan to buy the following: a mitre saw (a machine that cuts metal); a polisher, a rock drill and a medium hammer. This will allow him to improve his work and offer his customers a better service.

loans.use: to buy machinery such as a mitre saw, a machine that cuts metal, a polisher, a rock drill and a medium hammer.

loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
La joven Arely tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación desde hace 15 años , vende sopas de variedad todos los días su  labor empieza desde las cinco de la mañana que sale al bisne a comprar lo de la sopa, empieza a vender su producto desde las once y media de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde, es madre soltera  tiene un niño el cual esta estudiando y por el cual lucha por salir adelante y brindarles las mejores comodidad a su niño, la joven empezó con su negocio con ahorro propio estudiaba y decidió empezar con la venta de la sopa para cubrir sus estudios.

en la actualidad la joven ha mejorado su casa de habitación con ayuda de su mamá quien labora en la alcaldía como operaria de limpieza y entre ellas dos han sacado adelante el hogar, la joven solicito el financiamiento para hacerle mejora al local donde tiene su negocio esta levantando el techo y cambiando el zinc,

se siente muy agradecía con los financiamientos, ya que los ha sabido invertir, su casa la ha venido arreglando con mucho esfuerzo y poco a poco. es una joven que le gusta el trabajo y tiene muchos deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Arely has run her business in her home for 15 years. She sells a variety of soups every day. She starts working at 5 am, going out to the store to buy soup ingredients. She starts selling her dishes at 11:30 am and goes till 3:00 pm. She is a single mother of one. Her child is in school and she works very hard to get ahead and provide him with the best nutrition.  Areley Sugey started her business with her own savings. She was studying and decided to start selling soup in order to cover her study costs.
She has been able to improve her home with the help of her mother, who works for the town hall as a cleaner. Between the two of them they have been able to fix up the home. Areley Sugey is requesting this loan in order to make improvements to her home where she has her business. She is raising the roof and changing the zinc. 
She is very grateful for the loans, because she has known how to invest them. She has been improving her home with great hard work, bit by bit. She is a young woman who enjoys working and has a great desire to succeed.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to make improvements to her home restaurant.

loans.name: Juana Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como instructora de corte y confesión en  un centro que capacitan  que atienden a niños con problema de drogas. 

Doña Juana  solicita  un crédito ya  que esta terminado de construir su casa de habitación  que estaba en mal estado  con el financiamiento va a comprar zinc, ya que con el primer crédito que se le otorgo con kiva y Ceprodel lo utilizo en la compra de materiales  y esto le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Juana lives in the city of Managua. She teaches dressmaking in a drug treatment center for adolescents. 

Juana requested a loan since she is finished building her house that was in bad shape. With the financing she is going to buy zinc, since her first loan with Kiva and Ceprodel she used in the purchase of materials which has allowed her to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en:
Hosiyat is a woman with a kind heart and a good nature. She is 56 years old. She is married and has five children. Her children are adults and have their own work. 

Hosiyat and her husband do not have jobs. She wants to organize her own deal, as she needs to earn income. Her husband advised her to organize a business with animal husbandry, as he has some experience with animal husbandry. Her husband promised to help her manage the business. 

Hosiyat studied at the course “To Get Ahead” women’s organization, and got enough skills about business. She wrote her business plan. She will buy cattle, care for the cattle for some months, and resell them at the local market. She has a great desire to organize her own business, but does not have the money. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. This loan will help this family in poverty to find a source of income, and in this way to improve their living condition. Hosiyat awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 35 years old. She lives in Zestafoni District with her husband Vladimer, her 62-year-old  retired mother-in-law and three children who are going to school. Irma requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The family has two milk cows. Irma and her mother-in-law milk them every day to make dairy products. They also own a vineyard and an agricultural plot of land where maize is grown. Vladimer cultivates the land and harvests the grapes himself. The family has been in this business already for 15 years. All the produce is sold locally at Zestafoni markets and they have a small monthly income which is not enough to feed six family members . According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irma requested loan from Credo to start up the family business which was stopped recently, because of financial problems. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Irma will open a Georgian bread bakery. She will rent a place and seeing as using wood for fire will be more expensive, she will install gas pipes. Irma’s husband is a baker and he will be baking the bread himself. They will sell bread from the shop and will earn daily income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will help Irma to open her business, earn more money and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To open a Georgian bread bakery

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is single and has four children. She has received schooling through secondary school. Charlotte sells second-hand clothes in Abura and has done so for some time now. She uses her income to support herself and her children and save for their futures. Charlotte will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity and variety of second-hand clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charlotte plans to grow her clothes selling business further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Fadeelah

texts.en:
Fadeelah is married and has five children. She has received schooling through middle school. Fadeelah sells clothing in Abura and has done so for the past several years now. Her husband is an electrician. 

Fadeelah uses her income to help her husband in paying their family's expenses and saving for their future. Fadeelah will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fadeelah plans to grow her clothing shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Agnes B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers based in Waterloo, a town about 26 miles from Freetown. This group of teachers has applied for a loan in order to meet their immediate and most pressing financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Agnes is the featured leader of these borrowers. She is a native of Njala, southern Sierra Leone. The 41-year-old woman is married to a teacher and the couple has two children. Agnes has been a school teacher for many years now. Agnes is currently pursuing further studies in college. She has requested for this loan in order to pay her college fees.  

(Also attached to the right of the photo is Amara, a borrower who was not present for a group photo.)

loans.use: to pay her college fees

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina de 28 años esta casada con Virgilio de 30 años y juntos tienen dos pequeños hijos ,a quienes brindan todo el fruto de su trabajo.Posee una vivienda construida a base de madera el cual espera mejorar con el tiempo.Marcelina es una mujer dedicada íntegramente  a actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico .Desempeña esta labor desde muy niña y desde hace un año cuenta con una parcela propia que se encuentra próxima a dar sus primeros frutos de cacao. Sus tareas agrícolas las desempeña principalmente con el apoyo de trabajadores quienes apoyan  en el deshierbo y  traslado de la cosecha .Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que ahora ya cuenta con una parcela propia y esto a la larga le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos económicos.Desea contar con un capital para la temporada de cosecha que se avecina ,razón por la cual solicita 3,500 nuevos soles para proceder con la preparacion de dicha cosecha, asi mismo comprará plantas de almácigo y procedera con el reemplazo de plantaciones desfasadas de cacao .Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes esperando obtener ingresos paralelos a su principal actividad.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 28, is married to Virgilio, 30, and together they have two small children to whom they give all the fruit of their labor. She has a home constructed out of wood which in time she hopes to improve. Marcelina is a woman who's completely dedicated to agricultural activities relating to cacao and organic coffee production. She has been doing this work since she was very young, and for 1 year she has had her own plot that is close to its first cacao fruiting. Mainly, she performs her agricultural tasks with the support of workers who help with weeding and transporting the harvest. She likes her work very much since now she has her own plot and this will eventually allow her to earn a greater income.

She wants to have capital for the harvest season that's approaching. For this reason, she is asking for 3,500 Nuevos Soles to proceed with harvest preparation, and likewise, to buy nursery plants and proceed with the replacement of outdated cacao plots. Her long-term goals are aimed at opening up a grocery store, hoping to earn an income parallel to her principal activity.

loans.use: to buy nursery plants and the replacement of her cacao plots.

loans.name: Dani Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor  Dani trabaja desde hace 7 años  con su triciclo propio, es casado con su esposa tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian, y ambos se esfuerzan por sacarlos adelante, el señor trabaja  como albañil, decidio ahorrar para comprar su triciclo propio empezo alquilando el medio de transporte para su trabajo, posteriormente compro su triciclo.

El señor Dani trabaja de domingo a viernes  el día sábado el señor estudia ya que le brindaron media beca en una escuela mecánica. ya que el tiene muchos deseos de superación  en su trabajo el señor trabaja desde las seis y media de la mañana porque aprovecha el traslado de los niños a clase en su barrio y termina su labor a las cinco de la tarde.

solicita un crédito para dar mantenimiento a su tricilco, compra de pintura y ruedas. en su entrevista manifesto que se siente muy agradecido  con el  financiamiento anterior que le otorgaron,  su triciclo lo ha mejorado ya que es su medio de trabajo
texts.en:
Dani Lorenzo has had a rickshaw for seven years; he is married and has three children who study. Both parents struggle to give them a good future. Dani Lorenzo works as a construction worker and decided to save some money and buy his own rickshaw. Before, he had to pay for his transportation.

Dani Lorenzo works Sunday to Friday. Saturdays, he studies mechanics thanks to a partial scholarship that he received. He has a strong will to get ahead in life and works from 6:30 am - taking advantage of his children’s school schedule - until 5 pm. 

He is asking for the loan to pay for maintenance for his rickshaw as well as paint and wheels.  During his interview he said that he appreciates the loans he has received. His rickshaw has improved, which is an important tool for his activity.

loans.use: to give maintenance to his rickshaw (paint and wheels)

loans.name: Viki De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Viki De Los Ángeles vive en el centro de Managua departamento de Nicaragua, es una persona comerciante de ropa usada desde hace seis años, con la que ha contribuido en el sustento de su familia, es una joven de treinta años con aptitud positiva para el futuro.

 Se presento a  CEPRODEL  para solicitar  un crédito para compra de paca de ropa variadas como camisa falda chores y así poder atender a la demanda de sus clientes, esta actividad de venta lo tiene en la casa de sus padres. 

este financiamiento le ayudaría mucho para el desarrollo de su negocio porque  también  aumentaría su ingreso y tendría otro tipo de mercadería para ofrecer como ropa de cama. 

Viki dice, “Doy gracia a dios y a ustedes como micro financiera por brindar el apoyo a las personas de escaso recurso económico que lo necesitamos”.
texts.en:
Viki De Los Angeles lives in the city centre of Managua, Nicaragua. She has been a used clothing trader for six years, which has contributed to the maintenance of her family. She is a young person of thirty with positive aptitude for the future.

She introduced herself to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase an assortment of clothing in bulk such as shirts, skirts, and shorts thus she would be able to take care of her customer's demands. This sales activity is done in her parent's house. 

This funding would help her very much for the development of her business because it would also increase her profit and she would have other types of merchandise to offer like bed linen. 

Viki says, “I thank God and you the lenders for providing support to people of limited economic resources, we need it”.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Abdulia M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 23,100,000 Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that they would not otherwise be able to buy or invest in, left with their salaries alone. 

Some usually use these loans to buy plots of land, house-building materials, to pay school fees for their children, to buy pieces of furniture, etc. And at the end of each month, they use their monthly salaries to repay the loan. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for making the deductions and the repayments on their behalf. 

Ibrahim is the featured leader of this group. A native of Yoni Banna village, the 40-year-old is married to a housewife, and the couple has four children. Ibrahim has been a teacher for 13 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, metal rods, etc., for the construction  of an extension apartment, using the rest of the loan to pay school fees for his son. 

(Attached on the left of the photo are Mohamed and Fatmata; both are borrowers of the group but were not present for a group photo.)

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, metal rods, etc., for the construction  of an extension apartment, using the rest of the loan to pay school fees for his son

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Ms Noor is 43 years old, married and the mother of two children. For many years now, she has earned a living by selling various types of cloth. She buys the cloth from various wholesalers and sells it to her neighbors. She is well-known for selling high quality items. Her husband is pension holder and also works in a showroom but his income is not enough to meet all of the household expenses. That is why Mrs. Noor went into business and how the household pays the balance of its expenses. She has taken out and repaid two previous loans, and is requesting a third for PKR 35,000 to buy a variety of items to sell during the coming season. She believes that this will increase her income and allow her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Ms. Fozia is 28 years old and a mother of three children. For the past five years, Fozia has been running a business of milk sales. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has eight buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home and community. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters and wants to provide her family with good health and food. 

She has some savings and applied a loan of 30,000 PHR (Pakistan rupees) to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her second loan cycle and is very thankful to Kashf Foundation for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Ms Samina is 22 years old and the mother of three children.  She has been running a business of selling milk with the support of her husband for many years.  The man show in the photo is Samina’s husband. She started her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. Her husband was the only earner prior to that time. Over time her sales increased which increased her income.  

This has happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects an increase in her business income as a result of this loan. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for three years and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Brenda Xiomara

texts.es:
Brenda Xiomara es originaria de tisma pero por cosa de la vida ahora vive en un barrio de Managua  departamento de Nicaragua, donde ha convivido con su familia desde hace treinta años, ella se ha dedicado a su pulpería desde la seis de la mañana hasta nueve de la noche, deja de atender a sus clientes, con más de cuatro años que tiene de tener este negocio que sido un apoyo para el sustento de su familia y para la educación de sus hijo que están de estudio todavía.

Estoy solicitándole a  CEPRODEL un crédito, para compra de productos de abarrote tales como arroz, aceite, jabón, golosina, cereal y perecedero para abastecer la pulpería y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.

con estos financiamiento doña Brenda  ha podido ir aumentando su negocio y da gracia adiós ya ceprodel  por el apoyo le han brindado, así ha podido salir adelante logrando sus meta.
texts.en:
Brenda Xiomara is originally from Tisma but due to life’s vicissitudes she now lives in a neighborhood in Managua, Nicaragua Department, where she’s lived with her family for the last 30 years.  She works in her grocery store from six in the morning until nine at night when she stops tending to customers.  She’s had the business for more than four years and it’s been a source of support for her family and for her children’s education; they are still in school.

She’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy grocery items like rice, oil, soap, snacks, cereal and perishable items to stock the grocery store and meet customer demand.

Brenda has been able to gradually increase business thanks to these loans and she thanks God and Ceprodel for the support provided; this is how she’s been able to get ahead and approach her goal.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES ACTIVAS
Maribel es viuda tiene 5 hijos (24, 22, 20, 18, 10) se dedica a atender su librería, ella inicio hace un año y seis meses su negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en Bárcenas Villa Nueva,  Departamento de Guatemala, ella es cliente de FAPE desde hace dos años y ahora está interesada en obtener este préstamo para invertirlo en su librería(compra de cuadernos lapiceros lapiz etc) ya que la mercadería que tiene no satisface las necesidades de su clientes.  Ella anhela ver a sus hijos con una buena profesión y un buen trabajo espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que ella nececita para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Introducing the Dúo Mujeres Activas (Active Women Duo)
Maribel is a widow and she has 5 children (aged 24, 22, 20, 18 and 10). She engages in running her book store, an activity she started one year and six months ago. Her shop is located in Bárcenas Villa Nueva, in the Guatemala department. She has been a FAPE customer for two years and she is now interested in receiving a loan to invest it her book store (to buy notebooks, pencils, and pens etc.), as the products she sells do not currently meet her customers' needs. She wishes for the children to become good professionals and to have good jobs, and she hopes they will be able to support her in continuing carrying out her activity.

loans.use: To buy products for her book store such as notebooks, pencils, and pens etc

loans.name: Jose Emilio

texts.es: Jose Emilio de 54 años de edad, el se dedica a la elaboracion de trajes de vestir para caballero, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace años el vive en San Martin Jilotepeque, tiene su sastreria en su domicilio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de prendas de vestir ya que el capital que tiene no le alcanza para satisfacer la nececidad de sus clientes, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Jose Emilio, 54, makes a living making nice gentlemen's suits. He has been doing this for years. He lives in San Martin Jilotepeque. He has his tailor's shop in his home. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies for the fabrication of dressy clothing since the capital he has is not sufficient to satisfy the needs of his clients. He hopes that they can help him with the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy material for the creation of nice suits

loans.name: Bosque Del Pulpito Group

texts.es: La mayoría de los membros del banco comunal, Bosque del Pupito tienen comercios minores y tiendas de ropa. Ricardo es mecánico, tiene un negocio de servicio domicilio mecanismo. Empezó su trabajo como mecánico hace 18 año cuando trabajaba por un compañía. Hace 9 años que empezó su propia negocio lo cual le agreda mucho porque le ser su propio jefe y así puede pasar más tiempo con su familia. Esta Casada y tiene dos hijo minores de 9 y 10 años.  Ocupará su préstamo para comprar productos para el mecanismo como el aceite, discos de frenos y liquido de frenos. Ricardo compra su mercadería en la ciudad y lo vende en los áreas rurales. Mas adelantes, Ricardo le gustaría tener su propio local para el mecanismo. En el foto del banco comunal Ricardo esta atrás, por el lado derecha con una playera rayada.  Lo que mas le gusta de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es el apoyo de negocio que le dan, le ha ayudado guiar su negocio y mejorar y organizar su negocio.
texts.en:
The majority of members of the Bosque del Pupito Communal Bank have small commercial establishments that serve food.  Ricardo, however, is a mechanic and operates a mechanical repair shop from his home. He began to work as a mechanic around 18 years ago, employed by a company. About 9 years ago, he started his own business, one that he likes very much, because he is his own boss and  can pass the time with his family. Ricardo is married and has 2 minor children, ages 9 and 10.

Ricardo will use his loan to purchase items an auto mechanic needs, such as motor oil, brake discs, and brake fluid. He also buys merchandise in the city and sells it in rural areas. In the future, Ricardo would like to have his own mechanical repair shop.

In this photo of the communal bank's members, Ricardo is in the back row, on the right end wearing a stripped tee shirt.

What Ricardo likes best about working with Fondo Esperanza [The Hope Fund] is the business advice it offers. It has helped with the guidance, improvement, and organization of his business.

loans.use: to buy parts and supplies for a mechanic, including motor oil, brake discs, and brake fluid.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 29 years old. She lives in Batumi city with her husband Amiran and their three children. The older one goes to school and the two younger ones are going to kindergarten. Tamar has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tamar and Amiran have a bakery. They distribute baked bread at the local shops and get a small monthly salary which is the only source of income for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tamar has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business, Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with easy repayment conditions to country rural poor. They do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Tamar will rent a commercial space to open a fast food place and purchase all the needed equipment. Tamar and her husband are experienced in bakery business and they will both work hard to make their shop work. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will give them a chance to provide better living conditions for their children.

loans.use: To rent a commercial space to sell fast food

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Ms Kubra is a 23-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She is trying hard to fulfill the family demands including food, healthcare, clothing, and education. She has been running a general store for the past 6 years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Kubra’s husband. They are doing it for the sake of their family. She is able to manage her family needs and requirements effectively. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of the Kashf foundation. She has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy stocks of rice, flour and grains for her general store to fulfill the demands of her customers. Kubra is hopeful to increase her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour and grains for her general store to fulfill the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Fatama

texts.en:
Ms Fatama is 56 years old and the mother of six children. For the past 20 years, Fatama has been running a business selling milk. She started her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. Her husband was the only earner at that point in time. Over time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has three buffaloes and one cow. This has happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies.  She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 35000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. This is her 5th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Ms. Kaneez is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. She has gained five years of experience in this field.  Her son also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan rupees to buy packs of biscuits, oils and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, oils and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Afeera

texts.en:
Ms. Afeera is 36 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for six years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Afeera was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family; due to limited resources, none of their three sons were sent to school. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan rupees, and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads with packs of buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads with packs of buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en:
Shareefan is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. For the past ten years, Shareefan has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

Shareefan has some savings and has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, lace, and zippers to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is currently in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy cloth, threads of different colors, lace, and zippers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan, hombre trabajador desde  muy joven, parte de su vida la ha dedicado a la siembra y cultivo de Citricos, su mayor sueño es llegar a tener mejores condiciones de vida para sacar adelante a su familia, con el apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva ha sabido administrar sus productos y su cosechas ya que con los financiamientos ha dado un buen mantenimiento a sus citricos y sus productos han mejorado en gran manera, el siembra Mandarina, Limones, Naranjas etc. Comprara Insumos y fertilizantes necesarios como: Triple, Urea, Completo etc, Agradece a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por el Apoyo y la Confianza brindada.
texts.en: Juan has been a very hardworking man since he was very young, having committed a part of his life to planting and growing citrus fruits. His biggest dream is to succeed in reaching better living conditions for his family. Thanks to Afodenic and Kiva’s support he has been able to managed his products and harvests, as he has provided good maintenance to his citrus fruits thanks to the loan and his products have greatly improved. He plants mandarins, lemons and oranges etc.  He will buy farming inputs and necessary fertilizers.  He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for their support and trust.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Ms Suriya is a 29-year-old married woman and the mother of one son. She has a business of ‘waan’ manufacturing. Waan is a thread like material which is used to make a wooden bed frame that stands on four legs. She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors, and is famous for providing good quality material in her community. Suriya operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. They are doing it for the sake of her family. 

She is trying hard to fulfill the needs of her family members. She also does sewing as a part time job. In this way, she is able to manage her household more efficiently.  It’s her 1st year with Kashf Foundation. and she is satisfied with the support she has received. She has applied for a loan of Rs. 15000 to buy another machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales. She expects to boost her earnings and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the expansion of her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy another machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Ms. Maqsood is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained 12 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy packs of salts, oils and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, oils and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Favio Javier

texts.es: El señor Favio, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe  junto a su familia,  sus planes en la vida es que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda darle a su esposa e hijos  mejores condiciones para vivir mejor, el cosecha piña desde hace algunos años, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios para darle un optimo mantenimiento a sus cultivos comprara: Urea, Completo, Triple 20-15-20, con esto sus cultivo seran de mayor calidad y sus productos los podra vender a un buen precio ya que al darle un  mantenimiento preciso su cosecha mejorara. Agradece mucho a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por la confianza brindada
texts.en: Favio lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his family. His lifetime plans include succeeding in providing his family with the best living conditions in the near future. He has been growing pineapples for a few years, and thanks to this new loan he will buy the supplies and different types of fertilizers he needs to provide optimal care to his crops. With these supplies his crop with be higher quality, which means he can sells his product for higher prices.  He is deeply grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for having trusted him.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa de 33 años de edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar. Desde ya 10 años reside en casa propia gracias a Dios, siempre con el deseo de superación se caracteriza por ser emprendedora con sus que haceres domésticos y a la vez ayudarle a su esposo en su trabajo. Josefa al igual que su esposo se dedica a ser agricultor y alquila una pequeña parcela donde cultiva los granos básicos de la zona como lo son maíz y frijol, La cliente desea en estas próximas cosechas tener más ganancias es por esa razón que solicita INTEGRAL un préstamo el cual le permita comprar insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas entre otros; Y a su vez pagar el alquiler de la parcela ya que no cuenta con otros ingresos y esto es lo único que sabe realizar. Espera que la ayuda solicitada llegue así en su hogar no faltara el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Josefa, age 33, lives with her family.  She has resided in her home for 10 years, thanks to God.  Josefa has always had the drive to succeed and is known for being an entrepreneur.  She performs the household duties and also helps her husband with his work.  Like her husband, Josefa is farmer and rents a small plot land on which she grow basic crops that are local to the area such as corn and beans.  

Josefa wants to generate more income from her next harvest.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy farming supplies such as seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, and other items.  In turn, she will be able to pay the rent on her land since she has no other income.  This is the only way that she knows how.  Josefa hopes that the assistance she requested will arrive so that her household will not lack in its daily needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.es: El Sr. Eliezer, de 36 años  de edad es casado, su esposa trabaja como domestica, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de el. El cliente trabaja para la alcaldia como policia municipal. Solicita este nuevo credito para la construccion de un anexo que le servira como habitacion para sus hijos este credito le permitira una mejora en la calidad de vida de el y su familia ya que tendran un mayor espacio y comodidad para vivir.
texts.en:
Thirty-six year old Eliezer is married.  His wife works as a housekeeper, and he has 2 dependent children.  The client has been working for town hall as a municipal policeman.  

He is applying for this new loan for the construction of an annex that will serve as a bedroom for his children.  This loan will allow him to improve the quality of life for himself and his family, since they will have more living space and greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Walter Juan

texts.es: El sr. Walter de 46 años de edad es casado, su esposa es ama de casa tienen una hija que depende de el,  continua con su labor como operario de limpieza desde hace muchos años. Solicita este sexto credito para hacer un anexo que le servira como cocina, ya que en la actualidad cocinan en la interperie, este credito le ayudara a el y su familia mejorar sus condiciones de vida porque contaran con un lugar seguro para el momento de cocinar y no se veran afectados cuando este lloviendo.
texts.en:
Forty-six year old Walter is married.  His wife is a homemaker, and they have one dependent daughter.  He continues working as a cleaning operator, which he has done for many years.

He is applying for this sixth loan to build an annex that will serve as a kitchen, since they currently cook out in the open.  This loan will help him and his family improve their living conditions, because they will have a more secure place when they cook, and they won't be affected when it rains.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, iron and corrugated metal roofing.

loans.name: Elvin Jose

texts.es: El sr. Elvin de 32 años de edad es casado, su esposa trabaja como domestica, tienen una niña que esta en 5to año de secundaria. El trabaja para la Alcaldia desde hace 11 años como operario de limpieza. Con este credito el quiere terminar de cosntruir su casa ponerle techo, repello de paredes e instalar puertas y ventanas. Este señor a invertido cada credito que se le ha otorgado para construir su casa y brindarle a su familia un lugar seguro y agradable para vivir.
texts.en:
Thirty-two year old Elvin is married.  His wife works as a housekeeper, and they have one daughter who is in the fifth year of secondary school.  He has worked for the town hall for 11 years as a cleaning operator. 

With this loan, he wants to finish constructing his house -- put up a roof, plaster the walls, and install doors and windows.  

This gentleman has invested every loan he has been given to build his house and give his family a secure and pleasant place to live.

loans.use: to put up a roof, plaster the walls, and install doors and windows

loans.name: Evelio Antonio

texts.es: El sr. EveliO es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y se encarga del cuido de su familia que esta compuesta por dos hijos. El trabaja para la Alcaldia desde hae 12 años, de su trabajo depende la manutencion de su familia ya que es el unico que trabaja. Solicita este credito para hacer de concreto el piso ya que una parte es de tierra y darle fino a las paredes, este credito le servira para mejorar poco a poco su vivienda y contara con mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Evelio is married.  His wife is a homemaker and is in charge of caring for their family; they have two children.  He has worked for the township for twelve years, and the maintenance of his family depends on his job, since he is the only one that works. 

He is requesting this loan in order to install a concrete floor because part of his floor is dirt, as well as to plaster the walls.  This loan will help him to improve his home little by little, and to provide better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's group consists of four partners, all from Sahara in Dansoman. They are Lydia, Anita, Faustina and Frederick. They sell leather bags, tomatoes, wigs and provisions, respectively. They have been together since 2011. 

Lydia is a 28-year-old bag seller who is single. She needs 800 GHS (Ghana cedis) to buy more bags to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for the past three years and is doing very well. She is very loyal and truthful with all the loans she took from ID Ghana and is now applying for her third loan to meet her customers’ demands. 

The entire group needs an amount totaling GHS 2,000 to expand and buy more goods to meet the demand of their respective customers.

loans.use: To buy more bags to sell to customers.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús, habita junto a su hermosa familia su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre trabajador que siempre ha tenido y ha querido lo mejor para su familia actualmente se dedica hacer agricultor y cosecha los principales granos básicos de nuestro país, como lo son maíz y frijol. Siempre con el deseo de superación y nuevas visiones de vida. Manuel se ha forjado metas y gracias a Dios las ha cumplido esta vez no será la excepción y se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito, esta seguro que comprando insumos de calidad seguirá brindando una buena calidad de vida para su familia. El cliente desea comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes entre otros. Y espera contar con la ayuda solicitada, agradece de antemano a las personas de buen corazón que lograran que cumpla su sueño.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús is 44 years old and lives with his beautiful family, which includes his wife and children.  He is a hardworking man who has always wanted the best for his family.  Manuel currently works as a farmer and grows the basic crops that are important in El Salvador, such as corn and beans.  He always wants to succeed and achieve new milestones in his life.  

Manuel has established goals for himself and, thanks to God, he has been able to accomplish them.  This time will be no exception.  He approached Apoyo Integral with a loan request so that he could buy supplies, which will enable him to provide a better quality of life for his family.  Manuel plans to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and other items.  He hopes to have the assistance he requested.  

Manuel wishes to thank the good-hearted people who have helped him to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nelson Isai

texts.es: Nelson de 35 años de edad habita junto a su familia su esposa y sus hijos. Es hombre de hogar y responsable, procura para que toda su familia tenga una buena condición y calidad de vida, actualmente se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor cultivando maíz y frijol que es lo más buscado y consumido en el país. Nelson se caracteriza por ser muy responsable y en esta ocasión desea tener todo lo necesario para las próximas cosechas, es por ello que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros y espera tenerlos antes de la fecha prevista. Agradece a Dios por la oportunidad que le da en esta ocasión ya que tendrá la oportunidad de brindarle una buena calidad de vida a el y a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson, 35, lives with his family; his wife and children. He is the man of the house and responsible for his family's good health and quality of life. At the moment he works in agriculture, cultivating corn and beans which are the most sought-after and consumed food in our country.

Nelson is characterized as being very responsible and at this time he wishes to have all the necessities for the next harvest. That is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, to purchase agricultural supplies such as: seeds, manure, fertilizers, among others and he hopes to have them before the expected date.

He thanks God for the opportunity that he is given at this time as he will have the opportunity to provide a good quality of life to him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as; seeds, manure, fertilizers, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Mujer muy trabajadora que pese a las circunstancias que la rodean no pierde el entusiasmo de ser mejor en la vida y contar con una mejor estabilidad económica. Vive junto a su esposo e hijos, siendo una madre muy trabajadora que se dedica a su hogar y a su negocio que está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Tiene una pequeña librería en la que comercializa: cuadernos, libros, pegamentos, lápices, juegos de geometría y otros más, el mayor deseo de ella es poder invertir en más productos de librería para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y contar con inventario para todo el año y así atender a sus clientes. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y con mucha ilusión comprar todo lo necesario para su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: This client is a very hard-working woman who, despite the dangerous circumstances she lives in, does not lose sight of her dream of improving her life and having better financial stability. She lives with her husband and their children, and is a very hard-working mother who looks after both home and shop, the latter being located at her house. In this small shop she sells notebooks, books, glue, pencils, geometry games, and other such supplies. Her greater wish is to buy more products in order to have a wider array to sell at her shop and to have enough stock to last her the whole year and meet customer demand. This is why she asks field partner Integral for a loan, in order to buy the supplies needed and improve her business and her sales.

loans.use: to buy school and office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sara Margarita

texts.es: Sara de 35 años de edad, es una madre responsable, quien vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella trabaja muy duro comercializando leña en su casa de habitación, y así mismo en ocasiones la lleva hasta las casas de sus clientes. El negocio es bastante estable debido a que en la zona rural muchas personas utilizan la leña no solo para negocio sino también para cocinar sus alimentos. Sara solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de leña, obteniéndola a menores precios, lo cual le beneficia mucho porque de esta forma obtiene más ganancias de esta, lo que es primordial para Sara y para el sostenimiento de su hogar, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta.
texts.en:
Sara, 35 years old, is a responsible mother who lives together with her husband and two children. She works very hard selling firewood, as well as on occasion carrying it to the houses of her customers. The business is fairly stable as in the rural zone many people use firewood not just for their businesses but also to cook their food.

Sara requests a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of firewood, obtaining it at lower prices, which will benefit her greatly because it will increase her profits. This is a top priority for Sara and for the sustenance of her home since it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Ezri Humberto

texts.es: Ezri habita junto a su familia, conformado por su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia. Es un hombre muy responsable que toda la vida lo que más le ha importado es el bienestar de sus hijos y su esposa. Siempre con deseos de superación ezri ha trabajado toda su vida como agricultor y se caracteriza por cultivar las mejores plantaciones de la zona ya que tiene frijol y maíz. De lo que recolecta vende cierta parte y gracias a Dios siempre le va bien porque tiene precios accesibles al público y vende de mejor calidad, Ademas compra y vende naranjas. Ezri desea comprar insumos agrícolas antes que se llegue la próxima cosecha, es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de semillas, abonos, herbicidas, insecticidas entre otros. Cuenta con un excelente referencias de pago, cero atrasos, pues es un hombre comprometido con sus responsabilidades. Agradece a Dios y a las personas de buen corazón que harán que sus ganas de seguir cultivando los mejores productos lleguen a tiempo y así podrá seguir brindando una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ezri, 53, lives with his family, which comprises his wife and children, in their own house. He is very responsible, and the well being of his wife and children has always been very important. Ezri wants to be successful. He has farmed for most of his life and produces some of the best harvests of beans and corn in the area. He sells part of the harvest and, thanks to God, he has done well because he offers customers the best quality at affordable prices. He also sells oranges. 

Ezri wants to buy supplies before the next harvest and has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seed, manure, weed killer, and pesticide. He has good credit references and has not missed a payment. He is committed to meeting his responsibilities. He is grateful to God and the generous people who make it possible for him to keep planting the best crops on time so that he can provide a good life for himself and his children.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, weed killer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Jose Amadeo

texts.es: José de 39 años de edad habita junto a su familia su esposa y sus hijos. Es el hombre del hogar y el responsable que toda su familia tenga una buena condición y calidad de vida, Actualmente se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor cultiva maíz y frijol que es lo más buscado y consumido en el país. José se caracteriza por ser muy responsable y en esta ocasión desea tener todo lo necesario para las próximas cosechas es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros. Ademas tiene muy buenas referencias de pago. Espera tenerlos antes de la fecha prevista. Agradece a Dios por la oportunidad que le da en esta ocasión ya que tendrá la oportunidad de brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is thirty-nine years old and lives together with his wife and children.  He is a family man and is responsible for providing a good quality of life to his family.  Presently, he makes a living as a farmer, growing corn and beans, since these are the products most requested and consumed in this country.  

Jose is characterized as being very responsible.  On this occasion, he wishes to have everything that is necessary for the upcoming harvests.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy agricultural supplies, like seeds, manure, fertilizers, and other items.  Additionally, he has good payment references.  He hopes to have the supplies before the expected harvest.

He gives thanks to God for the opportunity that he has received on this occasion; he will have the opportunity to offer a good quality of life to himself and to his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, like seeds, manure, fertilizers, and other items.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Adan habita en casa de su  propiedad junto con su esposa  y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura, es decir a la siembra de los principales granos básicos como maíz y Frijol . Se ha dedicado a esta actividad toda su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día honradamente. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad con las demás personas. Debido a que la temporada para la siembra se aproxima ha tomado la decisión de comenzar a prepararse para la llegada de esa fecha. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante ya que es la única forma que conoce y hace para lograr tener acceso a una fuente de ingresos.  Además cuenta con buenas referencias de pagos. Confía en Dios que con su ayuda y su arduo trabajo lograr su sueño de lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Adán lives in a house he owns with his wife and children.  He works in agriculture, that is to say, he grows basic grains like corn and beans.  He’s worked in this his entire life and this is how he earns his daily bread honorably.  He’s a hardworking, responsible man who is known in the zone for his big heart and his kindness towards others.

Because the planting season is approaching, he’s decided to start getting ready for it and this is why he’s decided to request an INTEGRAL loan to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, etc.  His greatest wish is that his harvest is abundant since it’s the only way he knows to earn a living.  He also has good payment references and trusts in God that with your help and his hard work he will reach his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen has expertise in embroidery and stitching and is using her skill to provide for her family. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.

Previously, she borrowed from Kashf Foundation to purchase a sewing machine. Currently, she requested another loan worth 20,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees) to purchase more spools of threads with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors for making beautiful embroidery patterns. She says that the females in her community are becoming more demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Parveen has taken up. She is thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Ms. Nargis is a 32-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and three children in Punjab, Pakistan. She is in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan rupees to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Nargis dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Siempre hay decisiones y deseos fuertes en la vida, Aunque no todo sea fácil pero para todos hay nuevas oportunidades y este Joven es ejemplo de ello, alejado de la violencia social que afecta la localidad en la que reside, es responsable, honesto, trabajador y muy comprometido con su familia, Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo. Muy conocido por sus vecinos porque a pesar de las dificultades de la vida ha sido muy fuerte soportándolo todo, jamás se ha dejado vencer con cada problema que se le presenta. Al contrario ha sido ejemplo para muchos y principalmente para su familia de perseverancia. Actualmente se desenvuelve como agricultor de granos básicos como es maíz y frijol. Cada mañana se levanta con nuevas ilusiones y esperanzas de regresar a casa con el sustento diario y que su familia nunca le falte nada, pero la cosecha no ha estado muy buena es por eso que solicita un crédito que le permita comprar insumos agrícolas como: Semillas, Abonos, Fertilizantes, Pesticidas entre otros. Y confía plenamente que con la aprobación del crédito su vida mejorara en gran medida.
texts.en: There are always important decisions and strong desires in life. Although it isn't easy, there are opportunities for everyone, and this young man is an example of that. Distanced from the social violence that affects the community where he lives, he is responsible, honest, hardworking and very dedicated to his family. Right now, he lives with his wife and son. He is well known among his neighbors because despite difficulties in life, he has been very strong and managed everything. He has never let himself be defeated by every problem that comes his way. To the contrary, he has served as an example of perseverance for many, especially his family. Right now he is working as a farmer, growing basic grains such as beans and corn. Every morning, he gets up with new hopes and dreams of bringing home the daily support so his family lacks for nothing. However, the crop hasn't been very good and that is why he is asking for a loan to be able to buy farming products such as: seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides and more. He is totally confident that the approval of the loan will greatly improve his life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and more.

loans.name: Mary Chrish

texts.en:
This is Mary Chrish, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marcelo, a painter, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Chrish operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Mary Chrish dreams that her business will expand and hopes to have a prosperous life.  She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Inmaculada

texts.es: Inmaculada de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 18 años; ella desde hace 10 años se dedica a la actividad comercial, pues tiene un negocio de  artículos variados, ubicado en un espacio en su domicilio; Inmaculada inició este negocio una vez quedó desempleada, inició vendiendo productos artesanales en cerámica, solo comprando los biscochos,(estatuillas sin pintura) que ella misma decoraba con hermosos colores  para venderlos. Poco a poco agregó a su negocio mercancías variadas, estantería y toda la infraestructura de la que hoy dispone, apoyada en créditos que obtuvo a lo largo de su vida. En la actualidad ofrece en su estantería artículos escolares, ropa femenina exterior e interior, perfumería electrodomésticos menores etc, y vende estos productos  de contado y a crédito, comprando a distribuidores, que le ofrecen los mejores precios, que que le permiten llevar a su clientela la oportunidad de obtener artículos, a los que pueden acceder, porque los pueden pagar a plazos.  Hoy Inmaculada está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará de contado, para obtener mejores precios, calzado y una vitrina para surtirla, teniendo en cuenta que este es un producto que le suministra mayor rentabilidad y tiene una gran demanda en el mercado.   Su meta más adelante es tener un local independiente para en un futuro ganar más y lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales, lo cual potencializaría su éxito futuro.
texts.en:
Inmaculada is 46 years old and lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and two children aged 12 and 18. For 10 years, she has made a living as a businesswoman, she has a store selling various product in her home.  She started this business when she became unemployed.  She began selling ceramic handicrafts. She would buy cakes and paint them to sell them. Little by little, she added various goods, shelves, and all the furniture she has today, through loans that she has received throughout her life. 

At the moment, she offers school items, women's clothing and underwear, perfumes, small household appliances, etc. She sells these for cash or on credit, buying from wholesalers, who offer her better prices. She can then offer her customers the opportunity to obtain items that they can obtain.  

Today, Inmaculada is applying for a loan from Kiva. This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy cash to buy shoes at a better price and a display cabinet to stock them, as this is a highly-profitable item which is very in demand on the markets. 

Her next goal is to have an independent store to earn more in the future and help her children to become professionals, which will provide them will a successful future.

loans.use: have capital to buy shoes at a better price and a display cabinet to stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karen Maria

texts.es:
Karen María de 38 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 8, 3 años. Es originaria de  Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Nagarote se caracteriza por sus comidas típicas como el quesillo y el tiste. En sus ratos libre le gusta compartir tiempo de calidad con sus hijos; lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos  económicos. Pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de Enfermería titulada.

Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir  adelante Karen tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería la cual consiste en vender ropa de niño, cosméticos, pinturas de labios, rubor, crema hidratantes, ropa interior. Ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de unas 10 horas diarias, Karen se encuentra muy a gusto con su negocio, ya que ha sido el sustento de sus hijos.

Karen agradece a la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva, gracias a eso podrá invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar más mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Karen María, 38, is married and has two children, ages 8 and 3.  She's from Nagarote, located in the western part of the country.  Nagarote is known for its traditional food such as "quesillo" [cheese tortillas] and "tiste" [cocoa and corn beverage].  In her free time she likes to spend quality time with her children.  Unfortunately she wasn't able to attend college because she didn't have the money, but she would like to have been able to study nursing.

Thanks to her enterprising spirit and desire to get ahead, Karen works selling merchandise: children's clothing, cosmetics, lipstick, blush, moisturizing cream, and underwear.  She devotes about 10 hours a day to her business.  Karen is very comfortable with her business because it has supported her children.

Karen's grateful for the help from Kiva lenders, thanks to which she'll be able to invest in working capital and buy more merchandise, so she can get a better income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, cosmetics, lipstick, blush, moisturizing cream, and underwear

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Ms Fozia is 32 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for eight years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Fozia didn't earn income, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Fozia felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home when her husband divorced her and married again. Her husband also stopped providing for his family. She is a brave woman and hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation. She applied a loan of PKR 35,000 and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors. She is in her 5th loan cycle in Kashf Foundation and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en: Ms Sharifan is a 39-year-old lady and enjoys doing hand embroidery. She started doing this work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. Due to the increasing demand for her embroidery designs, she is involving other women in her business. She is a mother of 6 children; her husband is not in good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demand of embroidery she needs to hire some more women. She requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles and thread in different colors with the packs of sequins and stones which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and thread in different colors with the packs of sequins and stones.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and sells jeans. He has been in this business for the past 2 years and is doing very well. 

He joined ID Ghana in 2009 through another beneficiary. He is a very dedicated individual and hardworking. 

He has since taken out 4 loans from ID and has been able to repay without any default. 

He is applying for his 5th loan and needs GHS 700 to buy more jeans to sell to his customers in the Glefe community in Dansoman.

loans.use: to buy more jeans to sell to customers.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Ms Zeenat is 26 years old, married and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past six years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community and she earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of  PKR 25,000 to buy stock of thread with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors to meet the increasing demand of her customers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She has been in association with Kashf since four years and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy stock of thread with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms Nasreen is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been in the beauty parlor business for fifteen years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing good services, she has become famous on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a variety of cosmetics for her parlor. But because of having little cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, and packs of hair rollers. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is hopeful to cater to more customers in the future, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams to provide quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities and packs of hair rollers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize and vegetables to sell to customers

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah owns and operates a catering service near C.N.C. in Cape Coast. Hannah has received a tertiary level education. She is married and has two children. Hannah has been working as a caterer for some time now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more supplies and ingredients to operate her catering service. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her catering service and meet the needs of more customers.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and ingredients to operate her catering service.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 54 years old and lives in Kharagauli District with her 60-year-old husband Nugzar.  Lia requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Lia's family has two milk cows and she milks them every day to make dairy products. The family also owns an agricultural plot of land on which Nugzar grows maize. All the products are sold locally at the market. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lia requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Lia plans to go to Turkey to buy clothes at wholesale prices and resell it with prices marked up for her villagers. The profit will be reinvested in the same business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To go to Turkey to buy clothes at wholesale prices and resale them at marked up prices.

loans.name: Kumako

texts.en:
Kumako is a 36-year-old hairdresser married to Isaac a 40-year-old civil servant. She resides at Russia in the Dansoman community. They have two children who attend school. 

She is an individual member of the group that meets on Thursdays.

She has been doing in the hairdressing business for the past 11 years. She gets her goods from the Makola market on large scale and in turn provides them to her customers. She is very dedicated, industrious and very hardworking.

This is her fourth loan and she is requesting an amount of GHS 800 to help her buy more products for her customers in and around the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more creams and wigs to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hamamaoko Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 49-year-old Chido from Masvingo. Chido is married and has four children, one of whom attends school. Chido runs a food business selling sadza. The business has been in operation for three years. Chido says the main challenge she faces is the shortage of maize, especially in dry seasons when the cost is prohibitive. 

Chido has requested a loan of 300 USD to buy maize and mopane worms (a Zimbabwean delicacy). She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will go towards the purchase of a commercial stand. In the future, Chido plans to have her own stand rather than renting, which is expensive.

loans.use: to buy corn meal and mopane worms.
