She offers her products on a house-to-house basis and generates about P 5,000 monthly. She is now asking for additional capital in the amount of P13,000 to invest in the business. She will buy more dried fish to sell. She will also buy fruit to include in her sales. 

Someday, Mercedes would like to become a succesful entrepreneur and give better way of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and fruit to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alberto vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar y el futuro de su familia, es soltero y labora en una institución del estado desde hace tres años  desempeñándose como higienista.
  
Esta solicitando crédito a CEPRODEL para poder reparar el techo de su casa que está en mal estado  y este crédito lo utilizara en compra de cinc, perlin y pago de mano de obra.

este financiamiento lo invertirá en mejorar su vivienda y agradece a kiva a través de Ceprodel por el apoyo que le puedan brindar, porque solo así a podido ir  acondicionando su vivienda dando mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Alberto lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He is a hard-working person who fights for his family's well-being and future. He is single and has worked as a dental hygienist for a state institution for three years.
He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL for the purpose of repairing his home's roof, as it is in bad shape. He will use this loan to buy zinc and purlin beams, and to pay the labourers.
He will invest this loan in improving his home. He thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for whatever support they can provide, because this is the only way he can keep improving his home and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Belquis Guiomar

texts.es:
La  joven Belquis Guiomar, habita en una comarca de  Managua con sus padres, ella es madre soltera con un hijo bajo su cargo, es trabajadora de una universidad privada donde se desempeña como conserje desde hace un año.

Se presento a la oficina de CEPRODEL para solicitar crédito para la comprar materiales de construcción tales como madera, cinc, bloque para poder construir un pequeño cuarto para tener mejor comodidad.

Espera con este financiamiento poder invertir poco a poco la construcción  y esperando la  oportunidad que le puedan brindarle, para poder hacer realidad unos  de sus sueños y agradece la ayuda para tener la mejor su nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Young Belquis Guiomar lives in a region of Managua with her parents. She is a single mother with a child under her care. She has worked at a private university as a caretaker for one year.
She came to the CEPRODEL office to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as wood, zinc, and blocks, in order to build a small room and have greater comfort.
She hopes that with this loan she will be able to invest slowly in construction. She hopes you will be able to give her the opportunity to make one of her dreams reality. She is grateful for this help in having an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson, de 30 años, es un hombre honesto y muy amable,esta casado con Idaura con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años, actualmente vive en el terreno de su suegra ya que le brindaron un espacio en el que pudo construir su hogar .Emerson se dedica a tranportar pasajeros con su  mototaxi, realiza su trabajo por las principales calles de la ciudad en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros a quienes transporta hasta su destino con bastante serenidad ya que considera que la seguridad de sus clientes es lo más importante. Los 5 años de experiencia y trabajo lo colocan como una pieza clave en el oficio que desarrolla y complementa su trabajo con la venta de ropa ya que lo considera otra actividad rentable.Aunque al principio no le fue muy bien, afirma que ahora esa situación ha cambiado y sus ingresos se han visto multiplicados gracias a las recomendaciones de algunos de sus clientes . Ahora espera continuar trabajando como mototaxista y en un plazo relativamente corto desea consolidar su negocio de venta de ropa. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500 para la reparación de su mototaxi y el acondicionamiento de su local de venta de ropa, es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento ya que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Emerson, 30, is an honest and very friendly man. He is married to Idaura, with whom he has a two-year-old son. He currently lives on his mother-in-law's property, since she offered him a space where he could build his home.

Emerson makes a living transporting passengers in his motorcycle taxi. He works on the main streets of his city, searching for potential passengers who he then transports to their destination very calmly, as he considers his clients' safety to be of the utmost importance. His five years of work experience place him as a key player in this business. 

He complements his work with clothing sales, because he considers it to be another profitable business. Although this didn't go well at the beginning, he confirms that the situation has changed and his income has multiplied thanks to recommendations from some of his clients. Now he hopes to continue working as a motorcycle taxi driver, and in the relatively short term he would like to consolidate his clothing sales business. 

He has applied for a loan of 2500 Peruvian soles to repair his motorcycle taxi and refurbish his clothing sales stall. He is grateful to those who will make this loan possible, because it will help him to accomplish his goals. For this reason, he is committed to paying his installments on time.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle taxi and refurbish his sales stall.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia, es  comerciante minorista desde hace 3 años, tiene una mini-pulpería  abre desde las 5:30 am hasta las 9:00 pm de lunes a domingo.

Con el crédito comprara  mercadería de granos básicos que le han ayudado a incrementar sus ventas, y utilidades.

 Le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar.  Tiene una hija en edad escolar y por la que lucha para sacarla adelante.

 Se siente agradecida con Ceprodel, por la confianza depositada en ella, espera le sea otorgado.
texts.en: María Eugenia has been a retailer for three years. She has a small grocery store that is open from 5:30 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. from Monday to Sunday. She will use the loan to buy basic grains to increase sales and profits. Her business lets her provide for her household. She has a school-age daughter, for whom she strives to get ahead. She thanks Ceprodel for believing in her and hopes the loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy basic grains to sell and to buy a tricycle.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. For ten years now she has been a teacher. Harriet was inspired to go into service by her love for young people. Every time she sees one of her students graduate or get a good job she feels fulfilled. 

Harriet is requesting a loan to buy land for farming. In the future, she dreams of educating her children through the university level.

loans.use: to buy land land for farming

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is engaged in networking business, particularly selling herbal products such as coffee, food supplements, and juice drinks. She has also been engaged in the  livestock business for ten years.She is really glad because her husband is supportive in running their businesses wisely.

Susana would like to increase her stock of herbal products to be able to supply all her customers. But due to shortage of capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 allowing her to buy boxes of coffee, food supplements, and juice drink for her networking business and hog feed for her pigs.She hopes that her businesses will continue to grow so she can cover their daily necessities and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy boxes of coffee, etc., for her networking business and hog feed for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pottery business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her pottery business. She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gregoria Estela

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria se dedica a la venta de conchas negras, camarones y a todo tipo de pescado desde muy joven, ya que en el lugar donde ella habita se dedican a la pesca, ella cuenta con 3 lanchas las que son trabajadas por sus hijos y en donde ellos 3 veces por semana les toca ir a pescar para que posteriormente doña Gregoria realice su ventas en el mercado.

 comenta que ella inicio con un dinero que su esposo le dio para que invirtiera en el negocio ya que ella contaba con la experiencia, la cual había adquirido porque su mama se dedicaba también a la venta de mariscos y doña Gregoria le ayudaba.

Su hogar se compone de 3 hijos los cuales 2 están en edad escolar y uno de ellos le ayuda en la pesca.

 Los créditos son de gran ayuda porque le han permitido comprar sus lanchas para que de esta forma al realizar ella la pesca, mayores son sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Gregoria has sold black conchs, shrimp, and all kings of fish from an early age, since she lives in an area where fishing is important. She has three boats, which her children use three times a week to go fishing. Later Gregoria sells the fish at the market. She says that her husband gave her the money to start the business because she had gained experience helping her mother, who also sold seafood.

Her household comprises her three children, two of whom are studying while the third fishes. The loans are a great help because they allowed her to buy the boats so that they could fish and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy black conchs, sea bass, mackerel, corvines, shrimp, and nets.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila’s goal in life is to give her children a better way of living and to send them to school to finish their college education. 

Lucila is in her forties. She is married and blessed with four children. She is sending two of her children to school. They are in college and elementary school. Her two oldest children already finished their college. Lucila’s husband is farmer and a tricycle operator as well.

Lucila has run her sari-sari store business for 14 years. She wishes to expand her business site to become a grocery store someday. She will manage the business well. 

She works hard to increase her profit and be able to expand the business and reach her goal in life, too. In this connection, Lucila is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items in the market and sell them in their village. She hopes to attain her wish and goal in life soon.

loans.use: to buy grocery items in the market and sell them in their village.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel is 25 years old and has two children. She operates a retail store in their village. She has been in her business for over a year and earns PHP 3,000 each month. This goes for meals, school expenses and revolving capital, too. 

Lizel wanted to avail a loan to invest in her business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more grocery items (canned goods, eggs, bread, noodles and soap) to sell. 

Someday, Lizel hopes to achieve a profitable business for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items (canned goods, eggs, bread, noodles and soap) to sell.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 36 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en una casa, su esposo es vigilante y entre los dos llevan el alimento para sus hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir un muro perimetral para que no se deteriore el terreno en el invierno y represente un peligro para sus hijos. Ella lo que más desea es proporcionar a su hijos y nietos un hogar más digno y seguro y que no ocurra ningún accidente.
texts.en:
Martha, 36, is in a common-law marriage and has three children. For twelve years, she has been working as a housekeeper. Her husband is a security guard. They share the responsibility of providing food for their children.

She has applied for a loan from Fundación Campo to build a wall around the property to avoid damage to her land in the winter, which presents a danger for her children. What she wants most is to provide her children and grandchildren with a more respectable and secure home and for there to be no accidents.

loans.use: to build a wall around her property to prevent damage to her land in the winter, which presents a danger for her children.

loans.name: Rosalía  Marcela

texts.es:
Rosalía Marcela es una joven madre casada, con dos hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar, se desempeña como afanadora en una de la universidad privada, desde hace un año  que labora en dicha institución. Ella vive en una comarca  de Managua desde hace treces años.

Esta solicitando un crédito a CEPRODEL, para realizar  gastos de compra de puertas y ventanas ya que están en mal estado y necesita repararla para tener  seguridad en su vivienda.

La joven necesita este financiamiento para poder mejorar poco a poco el nivel de vida de su familia y espera el apoyo de estos organismos que ayudan a persona de bajos recurso económicos, ya que con su salario solo alcanza para el sustento de la alimentación.
texts.en:
Rosalía Marcela is a young married mother of two children, one of whom is of school age. She is a cleaning woman at a private university, where she has been working for one year. She has been living in an area of Managua for thirteen years.

She has applied for a loan from CEPRODEL to buy doors and windows, because hers are in bad shape and she needs to repair them in order to have security in her home.

Rosalía Marcela needs this loan to improve her family's living standards little by little. She hopes for support from these organizations that help people with limited financial resources, because with her salary she can only manage to cover the cost of food.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Ana,  habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe en la comunidad La Francia, ella junto a su  familia trabajan la tierra para poder obtener mejores ingresos en su hogar y poder mejorar sus condiciones de Vida. con este nuevo credito comprara los Insumos y Fertilizantes necesario para darle un optimo, comprara Insumos como: Triple, urea, Completo etc. asi la plaga y el mal tiempo del clina lo le afectara  en sus cultivos y sus productos estar mejor pare la hora de sacar la cosecha. Agradece el apoyo que A fodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Ana lives in the city of Ticuantepe in La Francia. She and her family work the land to increase the household's income and improve their lives. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and supplies such as Triple and Complete and urea to have the best harvest. Blight and bad weather hurt the crops, and her crops will be in better condition when harvested if she treats them. She thanks Afodenic and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 25 years old, married and has two children. Her spouse is a tricycle driver. Terry also raises hogs to sell for profit. 

She aims for an income increase, and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs’ sustainability. 

In the future, Terry hopes to keep raising healthy hogs and develop her business for income stability.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Saravuth

texts.en:
Saravuth (in the photo), age 21, is single and an English student at the Institute of Foreign Language in Phnom Penh. In addition, he is also an English teacher for a private school. 
 
Saravuth lives with his parents and brother and sister in a village approximately twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

He is now in his third year and first semester of his degree. He will finish the first semester and start the second semester of his third year soon. 

Hence, Saravuth decided to apply for Kiva loan in the amount of $500 to pay for his English school fees.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 23-year-old man. He is married with two children and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. After completing school and failing to get a formal job, he decided to venture into a produce business and the start is promising.

Julius is a farmer and most of his produce stock is directly from his land, but he also buys from other farmers to meet the high demand. Price fluctuation and limited funds affect his business, while his dream is to own a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round.

Julius intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia, age 48, is a devoted mother of four children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy cooking oil, sugar, coffee, vinegar and soap. She will stock her store because these goods are in demand. 

Sonia hopes that her business will succeed so that she can save and provide for the growing needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, coffee, vinegar and soap.

loans.name: Felicidad's Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIRIOS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betzabe es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, comercio de víveres, servicio de transporte, venta de pasankalla (maíz tostado), venta de comida, venta de sandwich’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betzabe es integrante, ella indica que desde el 2008 que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió cuando empezó a ser portera de un colegio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializara en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta as capacitaciones y  el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “LIRIOS” Communal Bank is starting its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada organization. The group has eight members and is governed by a board of directors. Señora Betzabe is the secretary. The members' businesses are varied and include: a corner store, grocery sales, transportation services, pasankalla (toasted corn) sales, food sales, and sandwich sales.
This loan will benefit these small businesspeople. Betzabe tells us that she has been a member of Pro Mujer since 2008. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling candy. She tells us that she learned this job when she started working as a caretaker at a school.
She will use this loan for an increase in working capital (buying candy). She will buy candy from the markets in the city of El Alto and sell it in her stall. This work allows her to generate an income to support her household where possible; she is married with four children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and the health area.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es trabajadora, luchadora que hace tortillas y vende frijoles cocidos diario de lunes a domingo de las 5 am a 2 pm en su casa desde hace 35 años. 

Ella lo empezó con su  negocio dinero propio. El crédito le ha favorecido en mucho ya que a obtenido mayores ganancias, poco a  poco a salido adelante con su hija.

 Con el crédito que solicita comprara  maíz y frijoles por quintales ya que antes compraba en las ventas cercanas y no le resultaba.

 con el crédito anetrior le ayudo a mantener materia prima y no parar de trabajar conservando asi, a sus clientes. por ese motivo agradece la oportunidad y espera le sea otorgado este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a hard-working woman. She has made and sold tortillas and cooked beans daily, every day of the week, from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm for 35 years.
She started her business with her own money. Loans have helped her greatly since she has obtained a greater income and been able to get ahead, along with her daughter, bit by bit.
With this loan, she will purchase corn and beans by the quintal. She used to buy from closer locations but it didn't work out.
Her previous loan allowed her to maintain a stock and to avoid having to stop working; therefore, she kept her clients. For this reason, she is grateful for this opportunity and hopes that this new loan is authorized.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans by the quintal.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 39 years old, married, and has children.  Due to financial difficulties in the family, she buys and sells fruits and vegetables to help her husband in generating income. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of bananas, gingers, squash, tomatoes, potatoes, and cabbage to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and make it more profitable to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, gingers, squash, tomatoes, potatoes, and cabbage to sell,

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 53 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos adultos; desde hace 18 años  se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, manualidades y artículos de marroquinería, actividades aprendidas gradualmente desde los 10 años de edad cuando inició el aprendizaje del tejido en un colegio religioso en el cual estudió. Así mismo aprendió culinaria, y las diversas manualidades que al cumplir su mayoría de edad las convirtiera en una forma de generar ingresos, pues quienes la conocían empezaron a interesarse en sus productos, y poco a poco fue comprando su máquina fámiliar, luego una fileteadora y así mismo ha sido  referenciada por sus amigos, hasta lograr construir un mercado que ha sostenido a lo largo del tiempo. En el taller de Carmen, practican varias líneas artesanales, marruqinería, pintura de cuadros, biscochos, elaboración de multiusos, ropa interior y hasta comidas especiales algunas veces. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y también a crédito otorgando un plazo de pago de 1 mes. La compra de sus materias primas e insumos las realiza de contado en almacenes especializados de herrajes, accesorios etc. Su meta es ampliarlo y más adelante adquirir una casa ubicada en esquina, que pueda potencializar su venta y sentirse mas cómoda y generar confort a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cuero, tablas acrílicas, cuchillo acerado, piedra de moler, lijas, pegantes herrajes, fique marcos etc. Su mayor desafío es continuar apoyando a sus hijos para que logren estudios superiores de calidad.
texts.en:
Carmen, 53, lives with her husband and has four grown children. Eighteen years ago, she began making handicrafts and leather goods, a profession she started learning when she took a weaving class at a religious school when she was 10. She also learned cooking and other crafts, which became her main source of income as an adult. People began to take notice of her merchandise, and over time she bought equipment for her house, including an over-stitch machine. Her friends recommended her, and she has built a market that supports her. 

Carmen makes a variety of artesania, leather goods, painted frames, mulit-use items, underwear,  biscuits, and even special foods in her workshop. She sells for cash and also offers credit terms of one month. She pays cash for her supplies at specialized warehouses that offer fittings, accessories, and more. 

Her goal is to expand and eventually buy a house at the corner, where she can boost sales, feel more comfortable, and better serve her customer. She is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy leather, acrylic boards, steel knives, a millstone, grinders, glues, fittings, hemp, and frames. Her biggest challenge is to keep supporting her children in their college studies.

loans.use: to buy leather, acrylic boards, steel knives, a millstone, grinders, glues, fittings, hemp, and frames.

loans.name: Milagro Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Milagro del Rosario, es trabajadora, luchadora, responsable, solidaria. Ella tiene una mini-pulpería que la abre diario de lunes a domingo de las 5 am a 9 pm en su casa desde hace 2 años, antiguamente ella trabajaba en un comedor. Ella empezó su negocio con su dinero propio.

El crédito le ha favorecido  mucho ya que a obtenido mayores ganancias, poco a poco a salido adelante con sus 2 hijos que están en la universidad, también obtiene la ayuda de su marido.

 Con el crédito  que solicita comprara granos básicos para surtir mas sus ventas ya que antes no tenía  variedad.

El crédito le impacto mucho porque gracias a ese préstamo no dejo de producir. Se siente agradecida con Ceprodel, espera le otorguen este crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Milagro del Rosario is a hard-working, responsible, and loyal woman. She has a small general store in her home, which she opens every day from 5:00 am to 9:00 pm. She has had this store for two years; before that, she worked in a restaurant. She started her business with her own money.
Loans have helped her greatly because she has made a better income, and bit by bit she and her two children have gotten ahead. Her children are both in university. Milagro del Rosario also has support from her husband.
With this loan, she will purchase basic grains to obtain a greater stock since she didn't have much variety.
Loans have helped her greatly, since thanks to them she has not stopped producing. She is grateful to Ceprodel and hopes that this loan is authorized.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, and eggs.

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоату 51 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 7 детей. Она с детства была очень трудолюбивой девушкой и помогала родителям по домохозяйству. После окончания средней школы она вышла замуж. Не получив высшее образование она осталась без какой либо профессии. После рождения детей у нее начались проблемы с деньгами. Ее муж занимался земледелием, и его доход ели-ели хватал на жизнь. После того как дети выросли Шафоат тоже начала заниматься земледелием. Данное время она нуждается больше денег, чем когда либо, так как дети выросли и надо их женить. С целью найти новый источник дохода, она решила организовать свой бизнес животноводством. Она прошла курс «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она обратилась в ИМОН с целью получения займа в сумме 2500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту, так как от этого нового бизнеса зависит семейный бюджет и будущее детей.
texts.en: Shafoat is 51 years old.  She is married and raising seven children.  She has been a very hardworking woman since childhood and helped her parents with the household.  Shafoat got married after finishing a secondary school.  Not having pursued a higher education, she was left without any type of profession.  She started having issues with money after giving birth to her children.  Her husband was involved in farming, but his income was barely enough for living.  Shafoat became involved in farming after the children grew up.  Currently, she needs more money than ever before because her children grew up and have to get married.  With the goal of obtaining a new source of income, she decided to start her own business in animal husbandry.  She completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  Shafoat came to IMON to obtain a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to buy livestock.  She awaits your kindness because her family budget and children's future depend on this new business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 49 years old, married, with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a coconut production or copra in the local community. She has been with her business for over five years and earns PHP 2,000 every month. 

She has joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a nipa hut.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie, aged 56, has been selling banana cue and juice as a source of income since 1993. She wants to increase her sales every day. To make it possible, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. It will be used to purchase bananas, sugar, juice and milk. She hopes the income that will be generated from her business will increase.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, sugar, juice and milk

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Batbaatar, 48 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional five-walled ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. His wife renders tailoring service to the local people, and before doing this, she worked as a janitor at a kindergarten. His eldest daughter is studying at college to become an elementary school teacher. His four-year-old daughter goes to kindergarten. He himself at one time held the position of driver at a private business entity. In 2012, he began rendering taxi services to the local people, and this was a better income generator compared to his full-time driver position. The automobile he uses for taxi service has been damaged and needs some serious repairs. So, he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to cover the costs of purchasing spare parts and changing the front side of his car. As a result, he will be able to continue to use his car for taxi services, thereby generating income for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to change the front side of his car

loans.name: Goodness And Mercy Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Sarah, from Gweru. She is widowed, with three children, all attending school.  

Sarah runs a retail business selling fruits and vegetables. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges faced are that there is no proper structure to operate from and the import duty is too high. 

Sarah is a member of Goodness and Mercy Group. She has requested a loan of USD 400 to buy more stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase profits, thereby expanding the business, hence providing employment to the community. 

In the future, Sarah plans to open a shoe retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул 36 лет, замужем, имеет шестерых детей. Сразу после того как вышла замуж в 1996 году, в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Майрамкул ведет свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве, начав со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день, ее хозяйство насчитывает 1 бычка и 0,6 га земли где ежегодно сажает картофель. Ежемесячно Майрамкул имеет доход в размере 6,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майрамкул обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. В бизнес – планах Майрамкул - увеличение хозяйства и расширение своего бизнеса, а в семейных – накопить сбережения для оплаты обучения детей.
texts.en: Mairamkul is 36 years old, married and has six children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she has been running her own business in animal husbandry and farming since getting married in 1996, having started this business with an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her diligence and persistence, today the business contains one bull and 0.6 hectares of land, where she plants potatoes every year.  Mairamkul has an income of 6,000 KGS.  In order to further develop her business, Mairamkul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  Mairamkul's business plans are to grow and expand her business, and her family plans are to save money in order to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rakhiyabu

texts.ru: Рахиябу 47 лет, замужем. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, в 1982 году Рахиябу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Начальный капитал для бизнеса составлял 3,000 KGS Благодаря упорному труду, Рахиябу смогла развить хозяйство численностью в 2 дойной коровы и 20 овец что приносит около 8,000 сом от продажи молока и молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахиябу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку годовалого теленка для откорма.Так как цены в этом году низкие, и ожидается повышение цен. Доходы Рахиябу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и улучшить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Rakhiyabu is 47 years old and married.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1982.  The initial capital for this business amounted to 3,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Rakhiyabu's persistent work, she was able to grow her business to have two dairy cows and twenty sheep, and yield about 8,000 som from sales of milk and dairy products and reselling livestock.  In order to further develop her business, Rakhiyabu requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a year-old calf for fattening up because this year's prices are low, but expected to rise.  She plans to invest the earnings into further increasing and improving livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy a year-old calf for fattening up

loans.name: Maria Asuncio

texts.es: La señora Maria, mujer trabajadora y luchadora, su sueño a  futuro es poder terminar su casa de habitacion y darle mejores condicones a su hijos ella trabaja para una casa privada y su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar, con este credito ella compra Marteriales necesario para continuar con la construccion de su casa. Comprara: Cemento, Arena, Bloques etc. Agradece el Apoyo que le han Brindado Afodenic y Fondos Kiva
texts.en: Maria is a working woman and a fighter. Her dreams for the future are to finish her house and provide a better quality of life for her children. She works in a private home and helps her husband with household expenses.  With this loan, she will buy the materials needed to continue the construction of her house. She will buy:  cement, sand, cylinder blocks etcetera.  She is grateful for the support provided by the Kiva loan and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. She is married and has 1 child. To make a living, she is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. She has been in her business for 6 years and earns about 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and soap. In 2010, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya is the operator of a van within her locality. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years. Ligaya would like to provide quality service to her passengers so that she can gain a higher income. For her to meet her goals in life, she is asking for additional capital, amounting to PHP 5,000, that will allow her to buy the necessary tires and oil for her van transportation business. Ligaya believes that through the additional capital that she has requested, she can further maintain the safety of her passengers, which could encourage more passengers to ride in her van transport.

loans.use: to buy the much needed tires and oil for her van transportation business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer engages in a general merchandise business. She sells electrical supplies, such as batteries, light bulbs, electrical wiring and fuse boxes. Jennifer is already 33 years old, married and has two children in school. Her husband is a government employee in their town.

Jennifer aspires to work hard and to have a prosperous business for her family. Jennifer wants to borrow P 30,000 to buy circuit breakers, light switches and florescent lamps. She hopes to increase her income and save some of it for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy circuit breakers, light switches and florescent lamps.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 3 children. For the past 6 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her stationary store, which sells computers and photocopies. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire other stationary and will help Betty to generate greater profits and increase sales. Betty hopes that in the future that she will be able to open another stationary store. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to acquire other stationary

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Loenora is 62 years old, widowed with 6 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 9 years and earns 3,200 PHP every month. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy an additional videoke unit for her business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional videoke unit for her business.

loans.name: Arelly Yahoska

texts.es:
Arelly de 29 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 10,3 años. Originaria de  Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar tiempo en familia con sus pequeños hijos. Les prepara algunas comidas típicas de la región “gallo pinto”. Lamentablemente  por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho trabajar en laboratorio clínico.
Gracia a su espíritu de emprendedor  y sus ganas de salir adelante, es que tiene por actividad venta de ropa la cual consisten en vender pantalones, janes, faldas, vestidos, short, blusas, camisetas, camisolas, ropa interior, juegos de sabanas, juegos de toallas. Actividad que la desempeña en unos de los mercado de la localidad; tiene ocho años de trabajar en el negocio; actividad que disfruta mucho ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. La rutina de trabajo de Arelly es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra  de ropa nueva variada. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Arelly agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Arelly, who is 29 and married with two children of 10 and 3, comes from Managua, in the centre of the country.  In her free time she likes spending time with her young children, for whom she prepares typical food from the region, such as "gallo pinto" (a rice and bean dish).  

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, she was not able to have a university education, but she would very much have liked to work in a clinical laboratory.  Thanks to her enterprising spirit and her determination to succeed, she has her own business selling clothing such as trousers, jeans, skirts, dresses, shorts, t-shirts, camisoles, underwear, sets of sheets and sets of towels.  She works in one of the local markets and has been running her business for 8 years.  She enjoys her work very much as it has been her way of life and that of her family.  Arelly's working routine involves selling her goods for 10 hours each day.  

The loan will be used to invest in working capital for the purchase of an assortment of new clothing so that, in the not too distant future, she can generate a higher income.  Arelly appreciates the help which Kiva investors provide for people of limited means in poor countries such as Nicaragua, since it enables them to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling new clothing such as trousers, jeans, skirts, dresses, shorts, blouses, t-shirts, camisoles, underwear, sets of sheets and sets of towels.

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en: Elyn wishes to improve her living situation. She is doing her best to provide for the needs of her family. She has been blessed with two children that also help her with fixing their poor living condition. As a 46-year-old woman, Elyn is selling seafood such as shrimp and fish as her source of income. Now Elyn is requesting loan of 6,000 PHP to buy shrimp to resell. She hopes to gain greater income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shrimp to resell

loans.name: Rustie

texts.en:
Rustie, aged 43, is from Buguey. She is married and works as an AVON, MSE, and Tupperware retailer. She has been operating this retail business for over three years and is happy for the good impact on their living situation.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to fulfill the orders of her loyal customers, such as slippers, bags, lipstick and lunchboxes. This loan will help her to increase her profit because she will be able to satisfy her customer demands, thereby generating more income.

loans.use: to fulfill the orders of her loyal customers, such as slippers, bags, lipstick and lunchboxes

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 36 years old and single. Her ambition in life is to become successful and financially stable to help her parents in financing the education of her younger brothers and sisters. Due to a lack of job opportunities, she put-up and manages her own computer shop near the school campus. She planned to acquire additional computers but she does not have enough capital. In this regard, she is asking for additional capital of P 25,000.00 to buy the additional computers. She believes that her loan will help her to improve the business and she hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of computers for rent

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 63 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Rosalinda owns and operates a fish selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over ten years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel is 23 years old, married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been with her business for over two years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2012 and now she has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ulugoy

texts.ru: Улугой 39 лет. Она вдова с одним ребенком. У Улугой среднее техническое образование. Она работала по специальности библиотекаря 7 лет. Однако последние два года из-за финансового положения Улугой одновременно стала заниматься земледелием. Она в дехканском хозяйстве арендует землю, где выращивает пшеницу. Так как сейчас сезон посева, Улугой обратилась в организацию за кредитом. Она просит кредит для посева пшеницы. За счет прибыли с урожая Улугой планирует приобрести большой жидко-кристаллический телевизор.
texts.en: Ulugoy is 39 years old.  She is a widow with one child.  Ulugoy has a secondary, technical education.  She worked as a librarian for seven years, however, had to also get involved in farming over the last two years due to financial difficulties.  She leases land at a dekhan farm, where she grows wheat.  Ulugoy came to our organization for a loan because now is the season for sowing.  She is requesting this loan to sow wheat.  Ulugoy plans to purchase a large plasma television with the profits from the harvest.

loans.use: to sow wheat

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar  est né vers 1980 à Bananso Cercle de KADIOLO, il vit avec son épouse et leurs 2 enfants à LOULOUNI dans la  troisième région administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
Monsieur Oumar en plus de ses activités de réparation de mobylettes et de bicyclettes, fait également l’achat vente des pièces détachées depuis maintenant 6 ans. Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso et à Bamako,acheminées à Loulouni les pièces sont mises dans une boutique près du garage aux abords du goudron. Il vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit.
Il est en collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux  ans et il est à son deuxième prêt, le premier ayant a été correctement remboursé. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, une quantité importante de pièces de rechanges.
Il compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux dépenses familiales,  une partie sera utilisée pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et le reste sera investis dans son activité.
texts.en:
Oumar was born around 1980 in the Bananso Circle of Kadiolo. He lives with his wife and their two children in Loulouni, located in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

In addition to his business repairing motorcycles and bicycles, Oumar has also been buying and selling spare parts for the past six years. He purchases his merchandise in Sikasso and Bamako, then transports it to a shop in Loulouni which is close to his garage and near the road. Oumar sells his merchandise for cash, on credit and at retail.

Oumar has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years and is on his second loan cycle, the first of which was fully repaid. With his current loan, Oumar plans to purchase a large quantity of spare parts. He hopes to earn a monthly income of 60,000 FCFA, which will permit him to better pay for his family's expenses. A portion will also be used to pay the interest on his loan and the remainder Oumar will use to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of spare motorcycle and bicycle parts.

loans.name: Maria Elia

texts.es:
La Señora Maria tiene 33 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia periférica de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
 Doña Maria es muy trabajadora, ya tiene 3 años de tener un negocio de venta de ropa para vestir, carteras y mochilas. Este negocio lo inicio con capital propio y así tener un ingreso extra que le ayudara a solventar los gastos del hogar, ella vende de forma ambulante en las colonias aledañas y también vende por encargo.
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Odef de 25,000 lempiras el cual utilizara para la compra de más mercadería (ropa, carteras, mochilas), para surtir el negocio y así poder ofrecer variedad de producto a sus clientes y sus ganancias sean mejores.
Su meta es trabajar y crecer en su negocio para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, age 33, is married and has three children.  She lives in a neighborhood outlying the city of San Pedro Sula.  Maria is very hard-working.  She has had her business of selling clothes, purses, and backpacks for three years.

She started this business with her own capital.  This way she has an extra income to help her pay the household expenses.  She sells in an itinerant manner in the surrounding neighborhoods.  She also sells by order.

She has requested a loan from ODEF for 25,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise (clothes, purses, backpacks) in order to stock the business.  This way she will be able to offer a variety of products to her customers, and her income will improve.

Her goal is to work and to grow in her business in order to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, purses, and backpacks to sell.

loans.name: Justo German

texts.es:
El señor justo German vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como vigilante en un centro de compras que se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, responsable en su trabajo y en sus obligaciones familiares.Su núcleo familiar lo conforman sus tres hijos y su esposa.

Don justo está solicitando a kiva y ceprodel un financiamiento para hacerle un chequeo médico, hacerle unos exámenes de laboratorio y la compra del medicamentos, ya que en este momento es necesario para la salud de su pequeño hijo.

El señor justo German  se siente agradecido con ceprodel por que los crédito anterior se le han otorgado los ha invertido en la compras de materiales de construcción  para su casa y así de esa manera ha venido mejorando su casa para la comodidad de su familia.
 en este momento podrá mejorar la salud de de su hijo que sin la oportunidad de este crédito le seria imposible lograrlo.
texts.en:
Justo Germán lives in the city of Managua, where he works as a security guard in a shopping centre. He has a reputation as an honest person who is responsible in his work and in his family obligations.  His family unit is made up of his three children and his wife.  

He is seeking a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to pay for a health check, some laboratory tests and medication, all of which are necessary for his young son's health.  

Justo Germán is grateful to Ceprodel for the previous loans which they granted him.  He used them to buy building materials to improve his home and make it more comfortable for his family.  He will now be able to improve his son's state of health, which would be impossible without the loan.

loans.use: to pay for health care for his family.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 42 years old, married with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting, harvesting coconuts and producing bananas to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber is 39 years old. He lives in the Zestafoni District with his 33-year-old wife Indira and son who is attending school. Kakhaber requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary of Kakhaber’s wife Indira. She is working in a local shop as a seller. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Kakhaber requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved under the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Kakhaber will purchase a mini-bus. He will be driving himself and serve the local people by transporting them from their district to different villages. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family and Kakhaber will be able to provide a better future for his son.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus

loans.name: Meregen

texts.en:
Meregen is 41 years old and married with two children.

Meregen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Meregen requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Meregen has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She wants to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Odgerel, 28 years old, lives with her husband and five-year-old daughter in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. The family has been residing in a rental apartment for two years. Her five-year-old daughter is being educated at kindergarten. Her husband has been holding a position of measuring millwright in the department of measuring of electricity, distributing station, for three years. She herself works as a hairdresser at a beauty salon. 

Her younger sister and she have decided to rent and operate a hotel in Ulaanbaatar. So she is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to pay two months rent fee for hotel operation. As a result, she can generate additional income for her family and invest in her daughter’s education. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a                                                                                                                                                                                            better future.

loans.use: to pay two months rent fee for hotel operation

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 35 years old, married with six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a coconut copra production business. She has been with her business for over five years and earns 5,500 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2009 and she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase tools for copra production.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for copra production

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur MOUSSA est né vers 1978 à ZANSO cercle de KADIOLO. Père de deux enfants  il vit dans une famille traditionnelle LOULOUNI - VILLE (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il possède d’un kiosque au marché de LOULOUNI VILLE afin de bien mener son activité de vente de poissons frais depuis maintenant  près de 2 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et notoriété.
Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il  sollicite la collaboration de l’Institution de microfinance Soro. Il est à son 1er prêt.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 200 kilos de poisson frais. Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de SIKASSO. Il les revend au comptant et en détail dans son kiosque à Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il ambitionne devenir un grossiste afin de ravitailler convenablement en poisson frais  sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’agrandir.
texts.en:
Moussa was born around 1978 in the Zanso Circle of Kadiolo. The father of two children, Moussa lives in a traditional family in the city of Loulouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Moussa has a booth at the market in Loulouni where he has been running his business of selling fresh fish for almost two years. His experience in this field has earned him a good reputation and notoriety in his trade. In order to purchase the supplies to satisfy the demand of his customers, Moussa has begun working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is currently on his first loan cycle.

This loan will enable Moussa to buy 200 kilos of fresh fish. He purchases his supply at the large market in the city of Sikasso. Moussa sells his fish for cash and at retail at his booth in Loulouni to a clientele composed of both men and women. With this loan, he expects to earn an average monthly income of 70,000 FCFA. This loan will allow Moussa to pay the interest on his loan and pay for his expenses. He will reinvest the remainder into his business. Moussa's ambition is to become a wholesaler so that he can properly supply fresh fish to his ever-increasing clientele.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Songuuli

texts.en: Songuuli, 38 years old, lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to the local people since 2007 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this service. A few years ago, he purchased a house and land with his savings from the taxi service. His wife lives separately from him. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase planks, which will be used for building fences. As a result, his parents can live in a more protected area due to the surrounding fences. With his parents protected, he can render his taxi service enthusiastically and generate more income for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase planks for building fences

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 45-year-old mother who has two school-age children. Currently, she is a single parent as she is separated from her husband due to family problem and conflicts. Despite this, she has the determination to uplift her status of living to give her children a better life. She is engaged in buying and selling used clothes in their community to generate additional income. 

Virginia planned to acquire more stocks of  used clothes to sell but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of P 20,000 to buy additional stocks. Through this loan, she believes that she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is 32 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri District with his 29-year-old wife, sister, retired father and infant daughter. 

Pridon requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Pridon owns an agricultural plot of land where the family grows citrus and different kinds of vegetables and fruit. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets. They get a small monthly income which is not enough to provide for five family members. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Pridon requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Pridon will purchase a mini-bus. He will be driving himself and serving local people within the bounds of the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family, and Pridon will be able to provide a better future for his daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus and work on a (bus) line.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a vegetable farm.  She sells her crop in the local community, which she has been doing for over nine years. 

Mary Ann is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She has joined GDMPC in 2012. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna, aged 51, cooks snacks for sale. That includes 'banana cue' (fried banana on a stick), 'camote' cue and 'fishbol'. She usually generates an income of PHP 200 daily. She wishes for higher income in order to give a good life to her family, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy bananas, 'camote' and juice. She hopes to have her request approved in order to have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy bananas, 'camote' (sweet potatoes) and juice

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is 41 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Gordon has been working hard to manage his poultry farm where he rears chickens. 

To help expand his business, Gordon has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock a brand of maize that will be used for chicken feed. This will help Gordon to generate greater profits and help pay bills and other family expenses. He hopes that in the future he will be able to increase on egg production . 

Gordon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gordon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock a brand of maize that will be used for chicken feed.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ofelia del Socorro de 48 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo de mayor de edad. Originaria del Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país.Ofelia se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos, no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracia a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de zapatos variados, de niños de adultos, de cuero, deportivos, tenis. Actividad que la desempeña en unos de los mercados de la localidad; desde hace 20 años que se dedica a dicho negocio. Actividad que disfruta mucho, ya que ha sido su forma de vida. La rutina de trabajo de Ofelia es trabajar unas 12 horas diarias.
El objetivo del crédito en invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de zapatos variados.  Ofelia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ofelia del Socorro is a 48-year-old single mother who has one adult son.  She is from Managua, which is located in the central area of the country.  She is a very hardworking and responsible woman and is motivated to better herself.   Regrettably, due to lack of financial resources, she was unable to pursue a college degree, and she was obligated to work from a young age in order to help with her family's household expenses.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her motivation to get ahead, she started a business selling shoes of all kinds for children and adults - leather shoes, tennis shoes, and shoes for other sports.  She sells her goods in one of the local markets, and she has been doing this for 20 years.  She enjoys the business very much, since it has been her way of life.  She works some 12 hours each day.

Ofelia is seeking this loan so that she can stock her business with various types of footwear.  She wishes to thank the Kiva lenders for the support that they provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.  This enables these individuals to have work that is dignified.

loans.use: to purchase various styles of shoes, such as  leather shoes, sandals and shoes for tennis and other sports.

loans.name: Ivon

texts.en:
Ivon wishes to stock her store, but she has insufficient capital. Therefore, this mother of three needs a loan to buy coffee, sugar, bread, soft drinks, flour, and spices. 

Ivon hopes to grow her business even more and satisfy the needs of her customers. She dreams of having a larger store so that she can generate more income and provide her children with a better quality of life and a good education.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, bread, soft drinks, flour, and spices.

loans.name: Altanzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Altanzaya, 27 years old, lives with her parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Both her parents have retired from work. She herself has been selling casual clothes for three consecutive years. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. She used her previous loan for purchasing and installing a ceiling in the house but couldn't afford to repair the roof. 

She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase metal shakes which will be used for roofing. As a result, in winter time, the family will be able to burn less coal to heat the house thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who has great business acumen and cares deeply for her parents.

loans.use: To purchase metal shakes for roofing

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita, 44 years old, is married and blessed with five children. She has owned and operated a tailoring business for almost five years and she's earning a net income of Php 2,000 a month. She would like to access a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase sewing equipment such as thread, tailoring marks, and needles to use in her business. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand and improve her work.

loans.use: To purchase sewing equipment such as thread, tailoring marks, and needles

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 50 years old, married and has 10 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a coconut plantation to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years. She earns 1,500 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 2,000 PHP to purchase harvesting equipment.  

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
To make living, Cresencia is engaged in a retail business. She manages a sari-sari store business in her village. Cresencia is in her sixties but still has the eagerness to run her business. 

Cresencia sells drinks, breads and candies. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice in their field. Through the income from her business, she was able to provide her children with school allowances when they were studying and they successfully finished their college studies.

Despite her age, Cresencia still dreams of seeing her store grow while she can still manage it. Cresencia wants to borrow PHP 20,000 to buy biscuits, condiments and eggs to sell in her village. Cresencia hopes to achieve her dream and earn profits for their future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, condiments and eggs to sell in her village.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is 34 years old and is a hardworking woman. She lives in the remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons who are students. Her husband has been running a transport business but his income is insufficient to meet the household needs. Therefore Saima is helping her husband to meet the family's needs by running a small embroidery business at her home. She provides embroidery services to her community. All of her clients appreciate her for her work.

Presently, she is need of purchasing some embroidery products like a variety of threads, needles, clothing, etc to continue her business. For that reason, she is a member of a five-person lending group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to increase her net income and savings as well. 
 
With the profit amount she wants to open an embroidery shop in the main market. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture Saima is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials like needles and variety of threads.

loans.name: Geresomu

texts.en:
Geresomu is a 42-year-old, married man with seven children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He trades in produce and, with the proceeds, he has been able to buy land where he practices farming and pay school fees for his children. The business is affected by unpredictable, seasonal weather changes which sometimes lead to low profits. His dream is to own a store that can sustainably supply his customers all year-round.

Geresomu intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia, a married mother of three, works hard to support her family. The operator of a food-vending business in the Philippines, Arsenia has requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp, as she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Arsenia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Issouf Kossa

texts.fr:
Monsieur ISSOUF est né vers 1984 à Bamako (capitale du MALI). Célibataire sans enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à Tagouasso – Kadiolo (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Issouf excelle dans l’achat vente d’articles électroniques notamment les téléphones portables et accessoires. Il possède un kiosque afin de bien mener son activité de commerce. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit beaucoup de commandes. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il décide de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et il est à son premier prêt .
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter une dizaine de téléphones potables, des façades et des cartes de rechanges. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et revend au comptant et en détail dans sa boutique à Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il ambitionne augmenter son capital afin d’aménager un endroit beaucoup plus accueillant afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Issouf was born around 1984 in Bamako (the capital of Mali). Single and without children, Issouf lives in a traditional family in Tagouasso - Kadiolo (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Issouf excels in the buying and selling of electronics such as mobile phones and their accessories. He has a booth so that he can properly conduct his business. Issouf's experience has earned him a good reputation in his field and he receives a large number of orders. In order to purchase the supplies to satisfy the demand of his customers, Issouf has begun working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first loan cycle.

This loan will enable Issouf to buy a dozen mobile phones, as well as face plates and pre-paid phone cards. He purchases his supplies in Bamako and retails his merchandise for cash at his shop in Loulouni. His clientele is composed of both men and women. With this loan, Issouf expects to earn an average monthly income of 90,000 FCFA. This income will allow him to pay the interest on his loan and pay for his expenses. He will use the remainder to reinvest in his business. Issouf's ambition is to increase his capital so that he can create a more welcoming shop for his customers.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, face plates and pre-paid phone cards.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Doña luz tiene un punto de venta de comida corriente, en la ciudad de san Rafael del sur, Managua, tiene seis años de tener su negocio con el que genera ingresos importantes para su hogar.

Su idea de negocio nace por descubrir la oportunidad que tenia de aprovechar la afluencia de personas que visitan el mercado, ya que su casa de habitación se ubica costado sur del centro de compras más importante de la ciudad.

Sin embargo, necesita de una fuente de financiamiento para mejorar su actividad comercial, mejorando la calidad del servicio y en la compra de insumos necesarios para elaborar el producto que comercializa.
Ella es madre soltera y pilar importante en los gastos básicos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luz has a mobile food stall in the city of San Rafael del Sur, Managua.  She has had this business for six years, and it has generated important income for her household.

Her idea to start the business came about when she discovered the opportunity to sell her goods to the large numbers of people who visit the market which is near her home.  This market is in one of the most important shopping districts of the city.

Nevertheless, she needs a source of financing to make improvements to her business.  She will use the funds to improve her level of service and to buy the supplies she needs in order to prepare the food items that she sells. 

She is a single mother and plays a key role in covering her family's basic household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase meat, seafood, rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is involved in selling fish and shrimp in her village. She patiently carries out this activity because her family is relying on her. 

Now, she wants to increase her profit by having more goods to offer for sale. However, she has insufficient funds to purchase all she needs. For this reason, Marites is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more fish and shrimps.

loans.use: to more buy fish and shrimps.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two working children. He is doing the best he can to satisfy his family demands and offer them a fair way of living. 

Hussein has been working in the construction field and has more than fifteen years of experience. He specializes in wall foliage and is waiting for the perfect time to grow in this occupation as much as he possibly can. As for his wife, she has been working at a local school since 2008. 

Today, Hussein is asking to borrow a loan from Viva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new construction tools for his business. In the future, he plans to open his own wall foliage products shop.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools for his business.

loans.name: Bell Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Belinda and Helina, a hairdresser and ladies' top seller respectively. They reside at Zone 6 in the Dansoman community. They have been together from 2012 to the present.

Belinda, a 27-year-old hairdresser and a single parent of one child, has been with ID Ghana for the past year and is doing very well. In her business for three years now, she works from Monday to Saturday. Her salon has allowed her to secure a quality education, and she is now requesting her second loan for GHS 800 to buy more products to sell to her customers. She is grateful to ID Ghana. 

Helina is requesting a loan amount of GHS 650 to buy more goods to sell to her customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more shampoo, cream, and wigs for her salon.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita works hard to support two children. She is married and has a business selling native foods in the Philippines.

Alita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. 

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer; the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Alita is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Hussein
