texts.en:
Hussein is a 32-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Rima, a beautiful young woman. They have only one child. He’s a great man who loves his family and really cares about offering them a respectable life. He works nonstop, on his own, to be able to cover their expenses. 

He has been working as a carpenter for many years. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which make his customers loyal to him. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase supplies and materials for his business such as paints, wood and many others. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to start his new project properly. 

He’s doing his best to collect higher revenues and offer his family a very comfortable life away from hard work.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and materials for his business such as paint and wood.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 36 years old and is blessed with three children. She involves herself in direct selling of AVON and MSE products. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 to purchase more stock of orders such as lotion, face powders, lipstick and cream. 

With her own efforts, she gained income and she is saving the income she gets from her business for her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of orders such as lotion,  face powders, lipstick and cream.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more groceries to sell.

Amalia has been in this business for twenty-one years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Amalia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina and her husband are both farmers who are raising their family in a rural community. They aim to improve their standard of living to give their children a better life. They help each other to cultivate their farm land by planting rice and some vegetables for sale. 

Aside from this, Florentina also engages in raising hogs to generate additional income. She plans to raise more pigs to sell but she has not got enough capital. 

In this regard, she is asking for an additional PHP 15,000 to buy the needed feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through patience and hard work, she believes that someday, she will make further improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy the needed feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anna Jean

texts.en: Anna Jean is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. For more than four years, she and her husband have been engaged in a boat transportation business. They use their boat to transport passengers from the island to the mainland. Anna Jean is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the boat. With this, they will be able to improve their business and earn an income. In the future, Anna Jean hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the boat

loans.name: Jessalyn

texts.en: Jessalyn, age 39, is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fish and shrimp for resale. With this loan, she is hoping to increase and expand the business. With the help of her four children, she is hoping for higher yields of income as she strives harder. In the future, she knows that she will achieve a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 49 years old and deals in maize planting and cattle. His business is seasonal and he has to be given quarterly installments if he is to meet his repayments in time. He will use the loan facility to buy dry corn as well as cows while they are still cheap since parents are selling to get tuition fees. Corn is also cheap apparently since it is harvest season. 

His challenge is weather that is unpredictable, sometimes it is the long dry spells while at times its the long heavy and windy rains that do not facilitate proper growth of both crops and animals. He believes he will meet his loan obligation on time. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy a stock of corn and cattle.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Kokouvi vit avec sa femme et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Il a 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. L’ainé est âgé de 09 ans et le dernier 05ans. Kokouvi quant à lui exerce comme activité la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. L’activité se déroule dans une baraque et il s’approvisionne généralement chez les grossistes. Son premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Le profit tiré de la vente lui servira de louer une boutique et de prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en:
Kokouvi lives in Lomé with his wife and his three children, two of whom are in school.  His oldest child is 9 years old, the youngest is 5.

Kokouvi sells general food products.  He conducts his activity in a small shack and he usually stocks up from wholesalers.  His first loan will allow him to buy general food products.  

He will use the profits from his sales to rent a shop and to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Dosseh

texts.fr: Peintre auto de profession, Dosseh exerce son activité avec deux personnes dans la zone portuaire. Afin d’acheter des peintures, des vernis et autres produits pour ses travaux, il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit. Le profit lui servira agrandir son activité et construire une maison pour sa famille. Notons qu’il est père d’un enfant de 02ans et vit avec sa femme à Lomé. Avec une ancienneté de 04ans, il est âgé de 34ans.
texts.en:
Dosseh is a professional automobile painter and he works with two other persons in the harbor area.  He is requesting a fist loan from WAGES to buy some paints, varnishes and other products for professional use. 

He will use his profits to expand his activity and to build a house for his family.

It should be noted that Dosseh is the father of a 2-year-old child and that he lives in Lomé with his wife.  He is 34 years old and has four years of experience in his field of work.

loans.use: to buy paints, varnishes and other products.

loans.name: David

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 25ans, David vit avec sa femme coiffeuse et leur enfant de 04ans à Lomé. Ce dernier est scolarisé. Employé dans une société de la ville de Lomé, il souhaite acheter une moto pour assurer ses déplacements. C’est justement pour cela qu’il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour effectuer cet achat. Avec l’économie qu’il fera en gagnant son salaire, il souhaite assurer une bonne éducation à sa famille.
texts.en:
David, aged 25, is a young man who lives in Lomé with his wife, a hairdresser, and their 4-year-old child.  His child goes to school.

As David is employed in a company in Lomé, he would like to buy a motorcycle to be used as a means of transportation.  This is precisely the reason why he is requesting a first loan from WAGES to make this purchase.

David plans to use his savings from his income to ensure that his family receives a good education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his own personal use.

loans.name: Los Angeles 16 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES DE 16 DE FEBRERO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas de bebe, niñera, tienda de barrio, venta de lana, tejido de chompas, costura de deportivos, carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó con el primer préstamo que hizo en Pro Mujer y en la actualidad de va muy bien.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de embutidos) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el compartir con las compañeras.
texts.en:
The community bank "Los Angeles de 16 de Febrero" is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer through its regional office Panamericana.  The group is comprised of eight members and is overseen by a board of directors, whose president is Mónica.  The members are involved in various businesses, including the knitting of sweaters; the sewing of clothing for sports; the sale of meat, groceries, wool and baby sweaters; and a babysitting business.

The loan they are seeking will benefit these small businesses, one of which is Monica's.  She reports that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of an outreach worker who visited her home.  Currently she has a business selling meat.  She started this business with the help of the first loan that she took from Pro Mujer, and things are now going very well.

She will use her portion of this loan to purchase sausage that she will acquire from distributors in the city of La Paz and then sell from her stall.  This form of work enables her to support her household in the best way that she can.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings they provide and the opportunity to share with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy traditional sausage for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 37-year-old single mother living in Kasese, Uganda. For 15 years she has been a social worker. With her savings she has been able to begin a transportation business by buying motorcycles. The high rate of mechanical breakdowns and high fuel prices affect her business growth. She is a good mother who is determined to change her future and her child's future through education. Juliet intends to use the loan to pay school fees for herself and her child.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Aminsi

texts.en:
Aminsi is 53 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married  and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 20 years, he  has been working hard to manage his restaurant. 

To help expand his business, Aminsi  has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital and buy more chairs, and will help him to generate greater profits and lead to increased returns. It will also allow him to start another business. Aminsi  hopes that in the future he will be able to keep his children in school. 

Aminsi  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aminsi  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add on capital and buy more chairs

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is 53 years old. He lives in Ambrolauri district with his 84-year-old retired mother. Nikoloz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nikoloz has a vineyard and an agricultural plot of land. He is cultivating the land himself and then sows maize and haricots. Nikoloz is making wine and sells the harvested products at Ambrolauri local markets. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nikoloz requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Nikoloz will purchase two milk cows. He will produce milk and make dairy products to sell locally at the markets. With the profit, Nikoloz plans to buy more cows and develop his farming. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will give him a chance to improve his living conditions and look after his aged mother better.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows to produce dairy products.

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik is 26 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and mother in the small village of Marneuli District. Rudik requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is involved in a trading business. In particular, they purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell at a higher price locally. The income from the trading business is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Rudik requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Rudik will purchase a stock of grocery products to sell. He has a commercial space where he plans start up a new grocery store. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries to start a grocery store.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 41 years old. He lives with his wife Rusudan and retired mother in Ozurgeti, West Georgia. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only income in the family is from trading. George has rented a counter at the local market where he sells vegetables and gets a small daily income. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence-poor category. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit George will purchase a mini-bus. He will use it for trading, to bring more varieties and quantities of vegetable. This will satisfy the client requirements better which will increase sales and George's daily income. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and he will have the opportunity to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus for trading.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina, a 53-year-old provisions seller for the past five years, resides at Bulemli in the Dansoman community, where she is doing very well. She is now requesting her fourth loan for GHS 1,200 to expand her business and buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy more milk, milo, sugar, rice and toffee to sell.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Avec une ancienneté de 04ans dans son activité, madame Dédé est une jeune dame de 46ans qui se bat chaque fois pour contribuer aux besoins du ménage de la famille. Son mari est comptable et ils ont 02 enfants de 18 et 12ans en charge qui vont tous à l’école. Elle revend des produits d’alimentation générale et des boissons dans une boutique et sollicite son quatrième prêt de WAGES pour renforcer son activité (achat de produits d’alimentation générale et des boissons. Le profit tiré lui permettra d’assurer une bonne scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Dédé, aged 46, is a young lady who has four years of experience in her field of work.  She always works very hard to help provide for her family and to cover the needs of her household.  Her husband is an accountant and they have two children, aged 18 and 12, who both attend school.

Dédé resells general food products and drinks in a shop, and she is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES in order to boost her activity (she will use her loan to buy general food products and drinks).

She will use her profits to ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy general food products and drinks.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 36ans, Akouvi est revendeuse de charbon de bois et des ignames. Elle a deux enfants scolarisés âgés de 08 et 05ans. Avec une ancienneté de 15ans, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et des ignames. Elle veut vivre heureuse en augmentant son activité et devenir grossiste.
texts.en: Akouvi is a young woman who resells charcoal and yams.  She is 36 years old and has two children, aged 5 and 8, who both attend school.  She has 15 years of experience in her field of work and is requesting a third loan to buy some bags of charcoal and yams.  She wants to live a happy life and plans to increase her activity and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy some charcoal and yams.

loans.name: José Bismark

texts.es:
El señor José Bismark vive en un  barrio de la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, actualmente trabaja para el estado desempeñándose en el cargo de responsable administrativo financiero desde hace dos años y medios, es una persona honesta, con buenos valores morales  responsable, casado con tres hijos a su cargo en edad escolar, que junto a su esposa que no tiene un trabajo estable lucha para darle a sus hijos, una educación profesional en el futuro.
  
En esta oficina de CEPRODEL se presento  don José Bismark a solicitar un crédito para construir un anexo de un cuarto, con este crédito comprara materiales como bloque cinc, cemento, arena.

Con este  financiamiento lo invertirá en ampliar su vivienda y darle una mejor comodidad y condición de vida  a su familia, porque sin este apoyo que brinda kiva a través de ceprodel no se puede hacer estas mejora.
texts.en:
Jose Bismark lives in a neighborhood of the city of Managua. He presently works for the state, having fulfilled responsibilities in financial administration for the last 2 ½ years. He is an honest and responsible person with good moral values, is married and has 3 school-age children in his charge. His wife has no stable job and they struggle to provide their children with an education that will prepare them for professions in the future.
  
Jose Bismark came to this CEPRODEL office to solicit a loan for constructing an annex to a room in his house. With the loan, he will purchase construction materials such as concrete blocks, zinc sheeting, cement and sand.

With this financing, Jose Bismark will invest in expanding his house in order to offer better comfort and conditions of life for his family. Without the help of Kiva through CEPRODEL, he would not be able to make these improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, including concrete blocks, zinc sheets, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of eight members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2012. They are Victoria, Gifty, Abedey, Regina, Rebecca, Lartekaa, Susana and Salomey. They all reside at Bortianor.

Victoria, Rebecca and Salomey sell smoked fish, Susana sells plantains, Abedey and Lartekaa sell banku, Gifty sells pampers while Regina sells cooked rice. ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Victoria is a 38-year-old fish trader who is married to Akwei, a 42-year-old driver. They have four children. She has 12 years experience. She works 6 days a week (from Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve her business. 

This is her 3rd loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting an amount of GHS 1,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 5,100 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 27 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past five years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which trades in garments

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add to his capital and buy more clothes to sell. This will help Joseph to generate greater profits and expand the business. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to have a big business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add to his capital and buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Seith

texts.en:
Seith is 27 years old and deals in cattle farming. He lives in a rural area and his aim is to add stock of young affordable cows that he will graze and later sell when they have gained value. 

The proceeds from the business will help him meet family basic needs and pay tuition for his children. His customers are the neighbouring community. He hopes to be the main supplier of milk in the area. His challenge is bad weather especially the dry spells. He is a hard-working and resilient man.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and lives in the town of Masaka in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Margaret has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells fresh juice.

To help expand her business, Margaret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fruit to make juice, and will help Margaret to generate greater profits and increase the income level of the family. Margaret hopes that in the future she will be able to have a variety of goods.

Margaret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margaret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to make juice.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is 20 years old and a single guy. He has two brothers and one sister. Rami works in a restaurant after school. He is majoring in Medical Laboratories. Rami is now applying for an educational loan, to pay the rest of his next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay the rest of his fees for next semester

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, 22 years old and single, has an older brother and sister. Mohammad is studying Hotel Management and is requesting this loan in order to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Geni

texts.es: Geni, de 30 años, es una mujer alegre, dinámica y emprendedora, esta casada con pedro de 30 años y tiene 03  hijos de 13 , 12  y 08 años, tiene una casa propia donde vive junto a su familia.Geni se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos por catálogo, tiene un local en la casa de su madre, el cual comprate con su hermana ya que ella se dedica a otro negocio. Lleva trabajando 06 años en este rubro y lo hace sola pues cree que así está mejor.Le gusta de su trabajo ya que tiene disponibilidad para muchas otras actividades además de tener ese contacto directo con la gente .Geni se dedica a traer los artículos y accesorios de moda asi como ropa de buena calidad para asi mantener a su clientela contenta ,por este motivo espera abrir una boutique bien implementada.Este será el crédito número 03 con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado  de 1200 soles, comprará mas productos, tales como prendas de vestir,zapatos , adornos para el hogar y algunas novedades mas.
texts.en:
Geni, age 30, is a happy, dynamic and enterprising woman. She is married to Pedro, 30, and has three children aged 13, 12 and 8. She has her own home, where she lives with her family.

Geni sells clothes, shoes and catalogue products. She has a store in her mother's house, which she shares with her sister who has another business. She has been working in this trade for 6 years and works alone as she prefers it. She likes her work as she has availability for lots of other activities as well as having this direct contact with her customers. Geni orders fashion articles and accessories as well as high quality clothing in order to keep her customers happy, it motivates her to hopefully one day open a well stocked boutique.

This will be her 3rd loan with Kiva, she is very happy to know that she will have financial support as it helps her feel safe to advance her business. For her part, she is committed to make her payments according to schedule once again. With the requested sum of 1200 PEN she will buy more stock like clothing, shoes and home decorations as well as other new things.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes and home decorations among other things.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is 53 years old and now a widower. He lives in a rural community with his two children. Aside from farming, he also runs a small variety store to generate additional income. He has aimed to improve his family’s standard of living to give his children a bright future. He planned to improve his variety store by increasing his product offerings but due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages and seasonings to sell. He believes that someday he will improve his business as he continues to work hard at it.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe started a sari-sari store business in her village. When she got enough experience of managing the business, and had earned enough capital from her income, she expanded the sari-sari store into a Karinderia (local restaurant). Guadalupe is engaged in selling cooked foods and daily menus in her village.

Guadalupe wants to cook additional recipes to sell but she can’t push it because she doesn’t have enough capital. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy meat, vegetables and ingredients to use in cooking foods for her daily menu. 

Guadalupe hopes to gain more income and continue her started store business to keep an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and ingredients to use in cooking foods for her daily menu.

loans.name: Saaban

texts.en:
Ms. Saaban is a 47-year-old, unmarried woman; she has been running a business of purchasing and selling animals for the past ten years, with the support of her brother. She buys animals (goats' kids) at low prices, grows them up and then sells them, out in the local market. She earns enough profit though her business to contribute to the family's income.

For the purchase of two more goats, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is hoping to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Ms Sharifan, a 51-year-old married mother of four, has been running a small general store in her community for the last eight years. She offers various goods for daily use. Her husband is employed in a small factory on daily wages, his earnings insufficient to support the needs of the family.

Sharifan is motivated to provide good living conditions for her family. She wants to grow her business and so has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy a stock of rice and flour to meet increasing customer demand. With a good repayment history, this will be her sixth loan. Sharifan wishes to utilize part of her revenue to meet personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and flour to resell.

loans.name: Helmis Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Helmis es comerciante de productos de cosméticos como: pintura labial, perfumes de hombre y mujer, champú, vanidad.Tiene ocho años de tener su propio negocio y contribuye económicamente en el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Gracias a su amable atención su negocio ha mejorado, su forma de venta es al crédito y al contado, su demanda ha crecido por lo que actualmente necesita una fuente de financiamiento para comprar un pedido de cosméticos, acción que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas.

Antes de tener su negocio era estudiante de belleza, y actualmente tiene su propio negocio independiente.

Es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, y su estado civil es casado.
texts.en:
Helmis sells cosmetic products like lipstick, fragrances for men and women, shampoo and make up. She has had her own business for 8 years and contributes economically to the upkeep of her home.

Thanks to her friendly attention, her business has improved. She sells on credit and for cash and demand has risen so that she is currently in need of financing to be able to buy an order of cosmetics, which will then allow her to increase her sales.

Before she had her business, she was a beauty student and currently runs an independent business.

She is the mother of a school age child and is married.

loans.use: to buy make up, lipstick, perfumes and shampoo.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 48 years old, married and has six children. Managing a sari-sari store is her source of income. She has been in the business for four years and she is happy that up to the present she is still managing her store. Her husband is a fruit vendor around their town. She and her husband are doing their best to meet their family’s needs. 

Virgie is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy drinks, breads, and biscuits to sell. She hopes to avail herself of the loan to extend the products she sells to her costumers and earn more profits. She is also hoping that she will meet her children’s schooling needs through the income generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, breads, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms. Nasreen is 52 years old, a widow, and a mother of two children. Five years ago she started the business of milk sales.  After the death of her husband, she faced many problems in managing her household expenses, with the educational needs of her children. So, she initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. With the passage of time her sales increased, and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Nasreen has some savings and requested a loan of Rs. 30,000, to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for five years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She is happy and feels proud to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Ms. Sumaira is a vigorous lady; she has been running a business of clothing sales for the past three years. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the big market in Peshawar at wholesale rates. Then she sells to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She knows that her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet all of their expenses, which is why she takes a keen interest in her business to earn maximum profit. Sumaira is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs in order to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members. Sumaira dreams of opening her own boutique at a nearby market.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 52 year old business-minded person. She is married to a carpenter and has five children. Three of her children have settled for marriage, one is working, and the youngest is still studying. Grace is raising three hogs to be fattened. She has been involved in this field of business for seven years. Through her patience and determination in life, she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 which will be used to buy hog feed, vaccine and essential vitamins for her hogs. Grace is hoping for approval of her requested loan, so she can ensure proper growth of her hogs upon reaching their maturity period. In this way, she could obtain a greater price for them, enabling her to improve her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vaccine and essential vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old guy. He is the older brother for three sisters. Ali is majoring in Insurance and Risk Management, in one of the governmental universities in Jordan. To help in supporting the family and himself, he works in a restaurant besides studying. But now he is short on money to pay the rest of his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay the rest of rest of his semester fees, for his study of Insurance and Risk Management

loans.name: Raneem

texts.en: Raneem is 22 years old and a single lady. She has three brothers. Raneem is majoring in accounting and is applying for a loan, which she will use to pay her semester fees. She is pursuing a BA degree in Accounting.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees in her program of study leading to a BA degree in Accounting

loans.name: Linda Urania

texts.es:
Doña linda tiene una pulpería donde vende una gran variedad de productos como granos básicos, carne, detergentes, cosméticos, verduras, entre otras cosas.

Su actividad comercial tiene cinco años de establecido y ha tenido una gran aceptación por su amable atención con el cliente, antes de tener su propio negocio se dedicaba al trabajo de campo, en un negocio familiar de ganadería, sin embargo por esfuerzos propios inicia su propia micro empresa de una tienda de productos comestibles.

Su negocio ha crecido, sin embargo ella necesita una fuente de financiamiento para diversificar su tienda y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su estado civil es soltero.
texts.en:
Linda has a grocery store where she sells a wide variety of products like basic grains, meat, detergents, cosmetics and vegetables, among other things. 

Her business has been operating for five years and has had a lot of success because of her kind customer service. Before having her own business she was working in the countryside in a family cattle ranching business. However, through her own efforts she began her own micro business - a shop selling groceries.

Her business has grown, but she needs a source of finance to diversify her shop and offer a better service to her customers. She is single.

loans.use: to buy basic grains like; rice, beans, sugar, oil.

loans.name: Rhita

texts.en: Rhita is a thirty-five year old woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a teacher who was inspired to serve by the conduct of her former teachers, whom she used to admire a lot. Like most government workers she faces a challenge of low salary that can hardly meet the demands of her family. Her dream is to venture into farming after assessing the high demand for agricultural products. Rhita intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Rowina

texts.en:
Rowina is 29 years old and married with one child. She is a hog raiser and owns a vegetable garden. She has been involved in her hog raising for two years. Aside from raising hogs, she also sells vegetables within the local community. 

Rowina’s desire is to get ahead in life and have a viable source of income. To help her to attain her goal, she is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000, which will allow her to buy feed for her hogs and fertilizer for her vegetable garden. She knows that through this loan she could ensure proper care for her hogs and improve the growth of her vegetables. Rowina hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted. In this way, she could earn a greater income, which will help her to meet her family’s needs and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 30-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. One of her sons is shown in the photo, standing next to Kalsoom. Her husband is working for daily wages and his income is not sufficient to support the needs of the family members. 

Kalsoom has been running a business of animal sales for the past two years to contribute to the family's income. She buys animals (goat’s kids) at low prices, grows them up, and sells them in the local market. 

For the purchase of two more goats, Kalsoom requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of profits on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is applying today for an educational loan since she went back to the university to get a bachelor's degree and to start working after that. Being a mother of two did not stop her from registering back in the university. 

Her previous loan was used to enhance her home business in clothing sales, but today she is applying for a loan to support her education and pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 26 years old, married and has three children. He deals in the goat business, and also does farming to supplement his business income in order to adequately meet the demands of his household. The purpose of this loan is to add to his stock of goats. His clients are local people. He hopes to expand his business, but his challenge is long dry spells which affect the productivity of the goats in terms of size and birth. He also spends a lot of money during such seasons trying to find water and feed for them. He wants the partnership with Kiva to grow into a long-term relationship and he hopes this will help him improve his business.

loans.use: To buy baby goats that he will rear then sell at a later statge

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан 58 лет, вдова. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1996 году Токтокан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве, стартовав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Токтокан, ее хозяйство со скотом приносит около 9,500 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли. На Сегодняшний день имеется 2,4 га земли и 3 голов КРС и 20 голов МРС. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтокан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота и на корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Toktokan is 58 years old and a widow. In search of a source of income for her family, Toktokan started her business of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation in 1996, with a starting sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Toktokan's persistent work, her business with livestock today brings in around 9,500 som (KGS) in monthly income. Currently she owns 2.4 hectares of land, 3 heads of cattle and 20 sheep and goats. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Toktokan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock and for fodder. Toktokan plans to invest the income from the loan in improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and fodder

loans.name: Aikanysh

texts.ru: Айканыш 62 года, замужем. Айканыш с 1999 года занимается животноводством, мать 5 детей, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом (KGS) в 2002 году. Благодаря упорному труду Айканыш, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется  2 коровы и 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, продажа молока и молочных продуктов и перепродажа скота приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айканыш обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и последующей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Айканыш планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины. И у них в семье предстоит очень важное и значимое событие, свадьба сына.
texts.en:
Aikanysh is 62 years old and married. She is the mother of five children. Since 1999, she has worked with livestock breeding. She started her business in 2002 with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aikanysh's persistent work, her business currently has 2 cows and 10 sheep and goats. The sale of milk and dairy products and the reselling of livestock bring in around 12,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Aikanysh turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows for fattening and then reselling. Aikanysh plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. There will also be a very important and significant event; her son's wedding.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет 57 лет, вдова, воспитала 2 детей. Младший сын живет с матерью.В 2005 году Бермет начала занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бермет имеется 2 дойная корова,1 теленок и 15 коз и овец. Приоритетной целью на сегодняшний день для Бермет, создать необходимую материальную базу для сына. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец, для откорма и последующей реализации. Доходы Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и построить дом на своем участке и женить сына.
texts.en:
Bermet is 57 years old and a widow. She has raised two children. The youngest son lives with his mother. In 2005, Bermet started working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Currently Bermet has 2 dairy cows, 1 bull and 15 sheep and goats at her farm. Bermet's prioritized goal is currently to the necessary material foundation for her son. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Bermet turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep to fatten and then resell. Bermet plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business and to build a house at her plot and marry her son away.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for resale

loans.name: Turkia

texts.en:
Turkia is a 49-year-old, conservative woman. She asked one of her sons to appear in the photo, instead. 

Turkia is a mother of six. One of her children is Abdulrahman, a 22-year-old man who is a university student. Turkia is now applying for a loan to support Abdulrahman in his studies and to pay for his semester registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester registration fees.

loans.name: Melkin De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Melkin es de oficio carpintero, labor que aprende desde muy joven con la finalidad de apoyar económicamente a su familia, no logrando así terminar sus estudios de secundaria.

Sin embargo logra ahorrar para poner su propia actividad comercial donde produce muebles como camas, sillas mecedoras y roperos.

Actualmente necesita capital de trabajo para comprar madera y atender unos encargos de muebles de sus clientes. Es una persona emprendedora y con deseos de superación personal. Su estado civil es soltero
texts.en:
Melkin is a carpenter, a profession he learned from a young age with the objective of supporting his family financially. So he didn't manage to finish his secondary school studies.

However has managed to save for his own business where he produces furniture like beds, rocking chairs and wardrobes.

Currently he needs some financial capital to buy wood and attend to some furniture orders from his customers. He is an enterprising person with the desire for self-improvement. He is single.

loans.use: to buy laurel wood.

loans.name: Martin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Martin Antonio vive en la cuidad de Managua  su hora de trabajo inicia a las 7 am y termina a las 5 pm. es honesto, responsable,  es el apoyo principal de su  esposa e hijos.

Don Martin solicita un crédito para invertirlo en  pago de matrícula y compra de útiles escolares  para sus hijos que están iniciando su año escolar.

Y la otra parte de préstamo lo quiere invertir en mejor su vivienda para darles mejor comedida a su familia. 

Agradeciendo a kiva y ceprodel por que con  los créditos obtenidos ha ido mejorando poco apoco  su casa.
texts.en:
Martin Antonio lives in the city of Managua. His working hours start at 7am and finish at 5pm. He is honest, responsible and the main support for his wife and children.

Martin is applying for a loan to invest in paying for enrollment fees and school supplies for his children who are beginning their school year. He wants to invest the other part of the loan in improving his house to give better help to his family.

He thanks Kiva and Ceprodel because with the credit he has obtained he has been improving his house little by little.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en:
Ekhlas is a 45-year-old, conservative woman. Her son, Abdulkareem, took her place in the photo.

Ekhlas is a working mother of two. She is applying for this educational loan to support her 20-year-old son, Abdulkareem, in the university and to pay for his semester registration fees. He is majoring in English Language.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 22-year-old guy who works to be able to cover his university fees. He is the oldest child in his family and has one brother and two sisters. Yazan is now applying for an educational loan, as he faced some shortages in paying his university fees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri is 33 years old. He lives in the small village of Zestaponi District with his wife, two children, and parents. Several times, Dimitri requested loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Dimitri works as a guard at local private company and gets a monthly income. In addition, the family has a dairy business. In particular, they have two milk cows and they produce cheese products to sell at local markets. The income is too small and is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Dimitri requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Dimitri will purchase chicks, raise them, and then resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, to raise and resell at a higher price.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 25-year-old conservative single lady. She asked her brother Ahmad to appear in the photo.

Asmaa is one of eight siblings in a family. She is applying for an educational loan to support her brother Ahmad, 21 years old, in his studies. She will use the loan to pay for his next semester fees. Ahmad is studying to become an archaeologist.

loans.use: to pay her brother's semester fees

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 51-year-old, conservative woman. She asked one of her sons, Odai, to take her place in the photo.

Alia is a single mother looking after her seven sons and daughters after her husband passed away. One of her sons, Odai, 20 years old, has recently enrolled in a university to study to become a school teacher. Alia is now applying for an educational loan to pay for Odai's semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Marilu Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marilu habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, mujer trabajadora, desde muy joven a luchado para darle mejores condiciones a sus hijos, ella es comerciante vende Ropa nueva y de segunda, con este credito comprara Pacas de Ropa de Segunda para niños, Adolescentes y Adultos ya que la demanda de sus clientes esta aumentando. Agradece el Apoyo de Afodenic y  Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Marilu lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children, a working woman struggling from an early age. In order to provide better conditions for her children she is a merchant selling new and secondhand clothing. Using this loan she will buy bundles of secondhand clothing for children, teenagers, and adults as the demand from her customers is increasing. She is grateful for the help from Afodenic and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing for her business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 44 year old conservative woman. She has asked her son Ramzi to take her place in the photo. 
She is the mother to three sons. She has a small tailoring business and also creates handmade embroidery. Linda primarily adds embroidery art to women’s dresses. She is applying for a loan to buy more sewing material and tools and to get a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy sewing material and tools

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, John  has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells soft drinks and alcohol. 

To help expand his business, John  has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks such as beer, wine and spirits to sell. This will help John generate greater profits which will help generate income. John hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to improve the business. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as beer, wine and spirits to sell

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en: Riyad is a 53 years old hardworking guy. He is father to five sons and daughters. Riyad has a carpentry business that he wants to enhance by purchasing new equipment that will increase the quality of works he does. This loan will allow him to do that.

loans.use: to bring new equipment for carpentry

loans.name: Thana'

texts.en: Thana’ is a 58 year old housewife. She has a small cosmetic sales business and has recently launched a tailoring and sewing business to increase her income. She is now applying for a loan to enhance her services by buying new thread and a better quality fabric.

loans.use: to buy new thread and a better quality fabric.

loans.name: Rola

texts.en: Rola is a 38 year old mother to two boys and two girls. While her husband is working at a hotel, she has started a small retail business at home selling home products. She is now applying for a loan to increase the quantity of housewares and decoration pieces that she offers for sale.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of housewares and decoration pieces.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Goreth is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past seven years, Goreth has been working hard to manage her pharmacy.

To help expand her business, Goreth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicines for sale, and it will help Goreth to generate greater profits and income. Goreth hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Goreth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Goreth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 54-year-old conservative woman; she asked her husband to appear in her loan photo in her place.

Amneh is the mother of one son and one daughter. They have an ice cream business where they make their own biscuit cones. Now Amneh wants to start making ice cream. She applied for this loan to purchase needed ingredients for testing before the spring and summer seasons start.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making ice cream.

loans.name: Hayjar

texts.en: Hayjar is a 44-year-old mother of nine sons and daughters. She has a small business at home mixing perfumes. She is now applying for a loan to buy more materials, scents, and tools for enhancing her business.

loans.use: to get buy supplies for her perfume business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 34-year-old mother of five daughters and a son. She recently started a sewing business and acquired a small sewing machine. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase fabric, threads, and beads to enhance the quality of her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, and beads.

loans.name: Gulsunda

texts.en:
Gulsunda, 35 years old, lives in Senaki with her 38-year-old husband Levan, parents, and three children who are going to school. Gulsunda requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but her requests were consistently rejected due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Gulsunda sells perfume, buying at wholesale prices and selling with price markups to the local citizens. She also has a commercial space at the local market that she is renting out. Additionally, the family is persecuted, so they get a monthly income from the government. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Gulsunda requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the received credit Gulsunda wants to rent a small place in the center of the city to open a shop where she will sell souvenirs and other such products. She will buy at wholesale prices and sell with price markups. This will increase her monthly profit. Gulsunda will use part of the profit to develop her business and another part to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to rent a shop to sell souvenirs and other such products.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en: Ratha is a 49-year-old housewife; her husband is a truck driver. She is caring for their three daughters and three sons. While being at home Ratha started a small business selling antique decoration pieces. She is now looking to enhance that business and include a few modern ones, and for that reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to include modern decoration pieces in her inventory

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 42 years old. He sells educational supplies such as text books, reading books, story books, pens, pencils, and mathematical sets. He has been in this business for the past ten years, and he is doing very well. He is a very dedicated and hardworking individual. 

He joined ID Ghana in 2007 through another member. He has since taken seven loans from ID and has been able to repay them without any default. He is applying for his eigth loan and needs 1,400 GHS to buy more educational supplies to sell to his customers in the Glefe community in Dansoman.

loans.use: to buy more educational products to sell.

loans.name: Development Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Development II” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sia. Sia is 54; she was born in Tankoro in the Kono district. She is currently residing in Koidu with her husband and six children. Her husband is an electrician, and two of her children are attending secondary schools. Sia has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells food in the market such as rice, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, and tomatoes. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy more food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in the market.

loans.name: Monawar

texts.en: Monawar is the mother of three sons. She has added blanket sales to her tailoring business to increase her income. Now Monawar is applying for another youth loan to buy new bed covers made from different material.

loans.use: to buy new bed covers for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is thankful because she has been able to educate her children using loans accessed through Ugafode and funded by Kiva lenders, Her children performed very well because they were not interrupted from their studies. She now wants another loan to pay tuition for her children. She is a hard-working and determined woman. She wants the relationship with UGAFODE and Kiva  to grow stronger and better.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 34-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her husband Salman to take her place in the photo. 

Salman is a public sector employee, and they have six sons and daughters. Salman has a few machines that he offers for rental. One of the machines that is showing in the photo needs some maintenance, and for that reason, Ahlam has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for repairing her husband's machine

loans.name: Obadia

texts.en:
Obadia is a 43-year-old second-hand jeans seller who resides at Glefe in Dansoman. He joined ID in 2009 and has been a member to date and is doing very well in his business.
 
He has been doing this business for five years now. He buys from Kantamato market in the capital and sells in the Dansoman community. 

This is his fifth loan with ID Ghana and he needs a loan of GHS 1,000 to buy more goods to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more jeans for resale

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, five of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Richard has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells items like sugar, flour, and rice. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for sale. This will help Richard to generate greater profits and meets his customers' needs. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to start another business. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items for sale.

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in a place called Tholie, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is 36 years of age. Kadiatu is married to a teacher, and the couple has one child who is attending primary school. For over five years now, Kadiatu has been selling shoes, slippers, and clothes. 

This is first loan that Kadiatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan to expand her business; she will buy slippers and clothes in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy slippers and clothes in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: St Thereza Group

texts.en:
Alex is a thirty-two-year-old married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For six years now he has been operating an electronics shop and also practices farming. 

The high cost of products and rental fees affect the business while his dream is to trade in solar products which are in high demand. Alex intends to use the loan to  buy electronics equipment to sell. He is a member of St Thereza group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to  buy electronics equipment to sell.

loans.name: Juliyasi

texts.en: Juliyasi is a married man with two children and resides in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a produce business which he has run for ten years now. He also sells alcohol in order to earn extra income. He dreams of buying a big lorry to help him in the transportation of produce to markets and from suppliers despite challenges of inadequate capital. Juliyasi intends to use the loan to buy maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Yerekun Gnini Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe YEREKUN GNINI sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à SIEKOURANI un des villages de la commune de Loulouni cercle de Kadiolo (Sikasso) 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
SALIMATA 1ère assise à gauche sur la photo, fait le commerce de lait frais à travers ce groupe de femmes YEREKUN GNINI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 170 litres  du lait frais. Elle s’approvisionne dans les parcs avoisinants du village de Siékourani. 
Elle les revend au  marché de Siékourani et au marché de Loulouni ville le jour de foire à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The six members of the Yerekun Gnini group are married women averaging 33 years of age, with three children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Siekourani, a village in the Louloni commune, in the Kadio district, the the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

They are on their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

Salimata, the first one seated on the left in the photo, is a group member who sells fresh milk. She plans to use her loan to buy 170 liters [about 45 gal] of fresh milk. She buys from local farms around the village of Siekourani. She sells at the Sikeourani market and the market in the town of Louloni on market days, to a customer base composed of both men and women, for cash.  She plans to achieve an average monthly  revenue of 17,000 West African francs, one part of which will be used to pay off her loan, and the other part for savings.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Ms. Rubina is a 29-year-old married woman. Her husband is a government employee but his income is not sufficient to cover all of their household expenses. She has been running a business of trading clothing for the past two years to contribute to the family income. 

She purchases a variety of clothing from the main city and then sells it to the people of her community. She has become well-known for selling good quality clothing. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 20,000 from the Kashi Foundation to buy stock of different clothing for the next season. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through higher sales. She is in her fifth loan cycle; her repayment history is remarkable. She dreams to provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of different clothing for the next season to meet the demand and preferences of her customers.

loans.name: Anty

texts.en:
Anty is 26 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past five years, Anty has worked hard to manage his business, in which he sells rice and posho. 

To help expand his business, Anty has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Anty to generate greater profits and more income. Anty hopes that in the future he will be able to buy land. 

Anty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Sulai

texts.en:
Sulai is 42 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of them are currently in school. For the past four years, Sulai has been working hard to manage his retail business, in which he sells sugar, salt, match boxes and other items. 

To help expand his business, Sulai has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items such as milk and salt to sell, and will help Sulai to generate greater profits and more income. Sulai hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his stock and grow his business. 

Sulai is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulai who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as milk and salt, to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 45 years old. He trades in home appliances (CD, DVD player, television) in the Glefe community. 

He has in this business for the past five years and is doing very well. He joined ID in 2010 and doing very well.

He is an innovative, and very organized and hardworking individual who is also committed to all he does.

This is his seventh loan. Patrick needs GHS 1,200 to buy more goods to satisfy his customers in the Glefe community.

loans.use: to buy more DVD players and televisions to sell.

loans.name: Bashil

texts.en: Bashil is a married man, aged 53, who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion for agriculture he started a produce business four years ago. He has also purchased a milling machine. With the proceeds he has been able to build rental houses to supplement his produce business and has also continued to farm. Bashil dreams of buying a vehicle to help him transport the goods despite the challenges of bad weather and bad roads that affect his business. Bashil is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Abou a 35 ans, marié et père de deux  enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Bougoula Hameau, commune rurale de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Abou après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au domaine du commerce dont il dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal. Il  mène des activités d’achat et vente des articles divers (Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, etc) il y’a maintenant six ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant six mois. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
Monsieur  Abou vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce  nouveau prêt, il compte acheter 5 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 3 cartons du thé, 2 sacs du sucre, 5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquet de Chewing-gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes et 10 cartons de savons. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre en détail.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abou is 35 years old, married, and a father of two. He lives with his family in Bougoula Hameau, a rural town in Sikasso (the third administrative district in the Republic of Mali).

After having tried several businesses without success, Mr. Abou taught himself how to run a business; he has a shop in front of his family home. He has been purchasing and selling assorted goods (cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc.) for six years now. He is highly sought after by his customers for the quality of his products.

To satisfy his growing customer base, Mr. Abou decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso six months ago. He is on his second individual loan.

Mr. Abou sells his wares for cash and on credit to a group of customers made up of men and women.

With this new loan, he plans to purchase five cartons of various cigarettes, three boxes of tea, two bags of sugar, five packages of candy, 10 packages of chewing gum, 30 packages of matches, and 10 boxes of soap. Mr. Abou gets his supplies from market wholesalers prior to selling them at retail.

With this loan, Mr. Abou expects to turn a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs, which will be used to contribute to the family expenses and to pay the interest on his loan; the rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted goods.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old. She sells porridge “Koko” in the Glefe community. She has been doing this business for the past ten years and is doing very well.

She joined ID in 2010.

Janet is an innovative, very organized and hardworking individual who is also committed to all she does.

This is her sixth loan. She needs GHS 1,200 to buy more cereal to prepare enough porridge “koko” to satisfy her customers in the Glefe community

loans.use: to buy more millet and sugar for porridge to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 35 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married with three children. Two of them are currently in school. For the past five years, Musa has worked hard to manage his retail business, in which he sells sugar, salt, match boxes and other items. 

To help expand his business, Musa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, match boxes and other items, and will help Musa to generate greater profits to support his family. Musa hopes that in the future he will be able to meet his customers' needs. 

Musa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Musa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and matchboxes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 36-year-old woman who sells stoves. She resides at Opetekwei in Dansoman. She has been in this business for the past four years and is doing very well.

She joined ID Ghana in April 2011 through another beneficiary. Grace is a very dedicated individual and hardworking. 
She has taken three loans from ID Ghana. 

Grace is applying for her fourth loan and needs GHS 1,000 to buy more stoves to sell to her customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more stoves to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 36-year-old photographer. He belongs to the Arise Group in Zone 6 in Dansoman. He joined Ghana ID in 2011.

Samuel has been in this business for the past five years. He serves his customers in and around Dansoman. 

He also takes both photos and videos at weddings, parties, anniversaries and the like. He is very dedicated and committed to his customers.

This is Samuel's sixth loan; he needs GHS 1,200 to purchase a video camera to serve his customers better.

loans.use: to buy a video camera.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 44-year-old seller of goods like milo, milk, rice and cooking oil. She is married to James who is a 45-year-old trader. They have three children. 
She resides at first stop in Dansoman.

In 2012, she needed capital to expand her small business and, through a friend, joined ID Ghana. Janet is hardworking, industrious and a committed individual. Since joining ID Ghana, she has been very faithful by repaying two loans in full.
 
This is her third loan and she needs GHS 1,000 to buy more goods to sell to her customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more milo, rice, milk and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
This is Theresa from Peace Group at Russia in Dansoman. She is 35 years old. Theresa has been a hairdresser for the past six years and is doing very well.

She always tells people good things about ID Ghana and how it has helped her overcome all her challenges in life. 

She is an innovative and hardworking individual who is committed to all she does. She has been with ID Ghana since 2008. 

This is Theresa's ninth loan; she needs GHS 1,000 to buy cream, wigs, and shampoo to serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy cream, wigs, shampoo for her customers.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

Lourdes successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Lourdes's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Franklin Antonio

texts.es:
Frankin de 24 años de edad, casado con un hijo de nueve años  de edad. Originario de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de país. Franklin se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador, responsables. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio obligado  a trabajar desde temprana edad para aporta a los gastos del hogar. Por tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor  a su pequeño hijo.
Gracia a  su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos varios  que consiste en vender, juguetes de niños pelotas inflables, carros, rompe cabezas, sillas de niños plásticas, calculadoras, peluches, planchas. Actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante y por encargos, la rutina de trabajo de este hombre es de 12 horas diarias con un bulto de 30 kg ofreciendo su mercadería. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que el sustento de su hijo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de  productos varios. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Franklin agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Franklin is 24 years old and married with one child who is 9 years old.  He is originally from Managua, a place that is located in the central area of the country.  Franklin is characterized as being a very hardworking and responsible man.  Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources he could not pursue a university education and he was forced to work from a very early age in order to contribute to the household expenses.  Therefore he struggles day to day to provide a better future for his young son.  

Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and his desire to get ahead he has as his economic activity the sale of various products that consist of children’s toys, inflatable balls, cars, puzzles, plastic children’s chairs, calculators, stuffed animals and irons.  He performs this work as a street merchant and by orders.  This man's work routine is 12 hours a day with a bundle of 30 kg offering his merchandise.  He carries out this activity with great pleasure as it is the sustenance for his son.  The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business in the buying and selling of the various products so that in a not-too-distant future he can obtain better income.
